Reviews.Title: “A great example of Form over Function”
Reviews.Author: Jim T
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, not "luxury", but nice. It is also clean.The people were very friendly and went out of their way to be nice to us. And the location is great. But when it comes to the hotel, it is a great example of a designer with no counter weight in terms of function. It drives me crazy to have to endure a designer's idea of things that look great, but have little practical value. Many of which are examples of things that are just not thought through. 1) a two story lofted room, with one telephone - you can move it upstairs or downstairs, but either way you have to run back and forth. 2) Maybe it is just a European thing, but a tub with a shower head, and no shower curtain? I am not talking about a spacious shower area with no shower curtain like you find in some cool hotels, with showers that are large enough to have a party in. No, this is a small round tub - but it looks so cool!!! But, combine the absence of a shower curtain, with slick painted concrete floor that has no drain and you are asking for a nightmare of a fall. Not to mention a mess. (doubly bad if the phone rings downstairs while you are getting out of the shower) 3) Add to this the fact that you cannot use the bathroom sink without water splashing all over the place, since its chic design is round, shallow, and the faucet sits about 12" above the bowl. But the shower and sink look so nice! 4) be sure to bring your Kevlar gloves if you get a lofted room - the glass and stainless steel staircase if fraught with sharp edges - they will slice your hand open if you are accustomed to using a handrail for its intended use - holding onto it as you navigate the staircase - but I do have to say that the glass and steel look exquisite!! Just not made to really be used (like the sinks and the tub). 5) The wireless or the hard wired internet - it crawls, if you can get connected in the first place. The login is so cryptic and we never could get the wireless to work in our room. They brought us a Ethernet cable - which works but still too slow to get email as fast as my iphone.... Really had to leave it running for a few hours to download my email. 6) If you get up early and want to work at the desk downstairs, after navigating the staircase. you get to sit at the desk downstairs - but, you cannot find a light that works to see what you are doing at the desk, unless you light up the whole place! You see the designer who did the lighting apparently thinks small lamps are not in vogue, so you have recessed ceiling lighting and the only way to light the desk work area, is to pretty much light up the whole place. Hmm, great unless someone is sleeping upstairs and you want to catch up on writing reviews or working... 7) The TV looks so nice hanging from the wall about 12 feet away from you as you lie in bed - you see, laying in bed is the only way you can see the screen. It is about 7 feet off the ground and does not tilt down -- so you can watch it from the low sitting bed - yes the beds are about 1/2 as high as normal beds, which is soooooooooo cool. The two look great independently, until you decide to use them together -- a tv way up on the wall, that does not tilt down combined with a low bed and very flat pillows. They could leave out the TV and add another telephone and a shower curtain and still have money left over to upgrade their internet speed. I could mention a few other things -- but time is short - we need to get designers to use their products to avoid these easily avoidable things........ the hotel is nice, just not luxury as I know it and not very user friendly is many regards. Last thing - message to designers - do not put a bed 1 step away from a spiral staircase, using a handrail that has sharp edges -- you are seriously asking for someone to get hurt!

Reviews.Title: “The good, bad and ugly”
Reviews.Author: alicia18
Reviews.Content: Good service, breakfast and location. Genuine helpful staff. Comfortable bed and pillows. Bad - no iron or adaptor - tip buy an iron and adaptor otherwise 8 euros to press trousers! Ugly - the decor something out of a 90's magazine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Steve M
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at La Griffe for the second time, booked on a Wotif Mystery Deal. I went back to the hotel for the second time due to its excellent location, clean rooms and very good value for money for Rome. On this occasion, however, the staff recognised me from my previous stay nearly one year before and went out of their way to make me welcome. This welcome extended to them taking me for coffee very early in the morning to their favourite coffee shop, where they purchased me a superb cappuccino. This was done entirely naturally and was one of the nicest gestures I have ever experienced in my extensive travels. Thank you La Griffe and thank you Mr Marianucci for the coffee - I will see you again in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel slap bang in the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Chrissie J
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at La Griffe. Room was clean and modern with great shower and a huge bed, nothing much else was needed as we were either out and about or to be found on the rooftop terrace which had great views of the city from a number of viewpoints. Our only disappointment was the plastic awnings covering most of the terrace as it was considered winter still (not for us brits who think temperature of 72 degrees is a fully blown summer). Also the lovely church ajacent was covered in scaffolding and plastic as well. Special thanks go to Joseph the doorman, who gave his complete attention to us, regarcdless of what was going on around us, and recommended fantastic restaurants and walks through the old, more intersting streets to and from various places. We particularly loved La Tritone which served an exceptional meal. Joseph made our stay that bit more enjoyable and 'real' as well as enabling us to maximise the 3 days we had. All in all, we were able to walk to pretty much all the main sights and took advantage of the hop on hop off bus which is a great way of getting to see everything efficiently. Great city, great holiday and a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “teenage staff”
Reviews.Author: Paul H
Reviews.Content: the teenagers running this operation would accept a cash only upgrade, and the price differed person to person. after being shown a room that we were quoted a $200 euro a night (cash only) upgrade, we tried to talk with another employee, who his price quoted was now $100 euro, we of course asked how the difference in the same room was now being offered at half the price? "well, the girl who was showing the room to you earlier, she can be a b-word".... After the very embarrassing exchange with what turned out to be the Assistant Manager, we opted to gather our bags and walk away from the two nights that had been prepaid for, and found a Hotel with a Service Industry Trained Staff. Not sure how La Griffe had been listed as a 5 star hotel with Ikea style children's Beds and plastic furniture in the rooms we looked at, but I guess that's why I felt the need to review.

Reviews.Title: “modren hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: elenasb13
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March. Got a great deal with Secret rooms, and it was superb value. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly, all spoke English. Room was small, and almost all floor space taken up by the MASSIVE bed. But, as we were in Rome to sightsee, not staying the room, we didn't mind. The bed was fantastically comfortable, and slept well every night. Some technical problems with the key card and sink leaking were fixed immediately. Really clean, and nice bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Please read these reviews & take them seriously”
Reviews.Author: DENISE R
Reviews.Content: My son & I stayed at this hotel March 4th - 7th. The hotel is in a great location for walking to all of the major sights & the metro is only a couple of minutes away for those further afield places. We arrived at 11 am & we were met by a very nice receptionist. Her english wasn't great but was passable. She told us our room wasn't ready yet & to go & have some lunch & come back in an hour. We could leave our cases. She then told us about all of the trips we could do from the hotel. These were expensive & very much a whistle stop tour of the sights. You can easily do everything on your own from this location. She also told us we would need to make a reservation for dinner, which we did for 9pm. As instructed we returned an hour or so later & were given our room keys. No directions to our room we given. We made our way to our room & met a man with our cases in the hallway. He had great difficulty getting the door open with our key card. He took our bags inside & left. The twin room had two single beds push together in the middle of the room & there was room for two chairs infront of the TV. The room faced onto the main road which was quite noisey especially in the late hours of the evening & the early mornings. The mini bar wasn't working & everything in it was warm. All of the electric then went off & we had to discover that the room key also activates the electricity in the room. But again it was very difficult to get the key card in the right position to keep the electric on. It became an art form all of its own. The bathroom looked bright & clean. However when we used the shower the bathroom floor flooded. This happened every time we used the shower. We couldn't work out where the water was coming from. By 8.30pm we were starving so we went up to the rooftop restaurant & asked if we could eat then rather than att 9pm. After the waiter made a lot of fuss, in italian, he showed us to a table. Where we discovered we were the only people in the restuarant, so what was the issue with us eating 30 mins early? We had one course each with vegs that cost extra, 2 cokes & one spirt. The food was bland & un exciting at best & the bill cam e to 113 euros. Be warned it was not good value for money & not good food. Breakfast was buffet with tinned fruits cold meats cereal, cake & pastries. Some very strange, greasy looking bacon & scrambled eggs that were cold. There was also tinned sausages/hot dogs. This was billed as American breakfast. My husband is American & I have no idea why they thought their breakfast was American in any way. When we returned from our day out we asked about wifi access & was given a sheet with the codes & passwords on it. It also said it would be charged at 10 euros per 24 hours. This was a mistake & it was free for our stay but we had to keep getting new codes. My son then asked where the gym & spa were & the receptionist said they didn't have a gym or spa. We later found it in the basement. 2 running machines for the gym & the spa was a bed with a towel on it. The hot tub on the roof doesn't exist either. Floor 10 is covered in building materials. We decided to watch the TV whilst we got ready to go out. The only english speaking channel was BBC news. There are NO other english channels, its all Italian or German. On the following day when we returned back to our room there was no hot water & it stayed that way for the rest of our stay. The bedding had been changed but there was dirty makeup on the pillowcases. All the reception staff would say was "no" when we complained & then acted as though they didn't understand. Also the lights in the bathroom stopped working & some of the lights in the bedroom also. The staff are uncaring & unhelpful when you need assistance. Having read some of the other reveiws I think we didn't do too badly at least our room had windows. There are many other hotels on the same road which are far superior to this hotel & cost a lot less. BE AWARE THIS IS NOT A 5 STAR HOTEL BY ANY STREACH OF ANYBODIES IMAGINATION & THERE IS NO LUXURY WHATSO EVER. IT IS NOT WORTH THE SORT OF MONEY IT CHARGES. AT BEST THIS IS A 2/3 STAR HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: Angie601
Reviews.Content: We have visited Rome a few times and this time chose La Griffe for it's central position and good transport (bus & Metro) transport options. We stayed 4 nights and had an excellent deal with Sectret Escapes and, as promised got an upgrade to a delux room with a bottle of prosecco and fruit. The room was large, mininialistic and clean with good dressing area with plenty or hidden storage and 2 comfortable arm chairs and good bathroom (no bath but that wasn't a problem). The staff were all very helpful, I think it was Natalie on reception, she was new and very helpful and always greeted us by name. Also the 2 doormen were very good, Joseph being very knowledgable and understanding that we weren't there to be spending silly money! We found the breakfast buffet very good for our needs, we never bothered with cooked so can't comment and also found the restaurant staff very polite and helpful. (The coffee could have been a bit hotter but as we didn't complain I can't say if they would have addressed this). We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Less than expected from a 5 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bilal D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the La Griffe Hotel on friday the 17th and saturday the 18th of February. The location of the hotel is very good since it is close to a lot of nice things to see in Rome, 15 mins walking distance from the Colosseum, 15 mins walking distance from the Fontana Di Trevi, and so on. The rooms are very nice, but the heating system can not be controlled from the room, it was too hot and it took me 3 calls to the reception to have them turn off the heating system. The hotel itself is very dark, the lobby and corridors walls are all painted in dark gray with minimal lightning. The concierge reserved for us at a VERY GOOD restaurant (it had the best pasta i ever had in my life) called "La Tritone". The worst part of my stay was the breakfast. The quality of the food is really not as expected from a 5 stars hotel, very poor buffet. All in all, a good hotel but not what i expected.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Disappointing For a Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: R0meV
Reviews.Content: Location was very central for going to the Coliseum, Trevoli Fountain etc. However room was small (for a twin room) although beds comfy. Good to have a safe in the room. The advertised entertainment for the Sat evening did not actually happen, in fact the hotel bar was not even open. Breakfast was awful for a luxury hotel, the yoghurt, cold meat and fruit sections were warm and the hot food selection minimal - bacon too greasy, sausages cold and scrambled egg overcooked. Reception and concierge very helpful, waiters not overly friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the center”
Reviews.Author: tbrad82
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an enviable location. You can walk to the Coliseum and to the railroad terminal if you want to travel to places like Florence for a day trip if you get tired of Rome itself. The staff was friendly and helpful. They can book your city tour bus trips and your ride back to the airport for you. You can also walk to shops, bar and restaurants from here. Room was charming but the bathroom, while stylish, wasn't the most functional in terms of vanity space. The breaksfast buffet was a must for us at only 10 euros per person. Also, check out the rooftop loungs in warmer weather for a beaufitful view. I had a positive experience here and would return if I am in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Great in the City Center”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value in the center of the city. We were able to walk (and get lost) all on our own. This hotel is within walking distance to almost all of the sites you might most want to see in Rome. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. We had absolutely no issues with the service at this hotel. In much of Rome, we surprised by the no rush service, but that was not the case at this hotel. The breakfast was terrific with many choices. Although we visited in the winter, the rooftop eating was great, warm and had a great view of the city. I am sure this is even better in the summer. Oh, and the coffee was very good--very important for me. Our room was great by Italian standards. Like many hotels in Italy, they had pushed two twin beds together with a bigger sheet, which worked out okay for us. The bathroom had a fantastic shower and a heated towel rack. The decor is minimalist, but fine. We also stayed days later at the Sheraton near the airport. I liked La Griffe much better.

Reviews.Title: “Central and Good!”
Reviews.Author: Elaine D
Reviews.Content: Ok maybe 5 stars ARE TOO much! 3-4 but very clean and big rooms in d centre of rome - which is no normal for rome! rly enjoyed it - basic bfast - a lot of fancy sweets in d morning - then cold coffee - but on d whole ok! :-) an enjoyable weekend with a lot of shopping to do around - within reasonable distance (we did it on foot) to all main attractions ! took only once d bus to go to vatican! They meeted all our requests- extra pillows as well .. thnx la griffe

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: maltajp
Reviews.Content: for me, we had a nice hotel in centre of rome with a good price, what i could ask for more...then only thing the room had is that when you take a shower you could see water on floor, but this happen to me only and not to my friends, which used the same shower. this could be the way i put the shower...

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel ? They tried, I am not convinced...”
Reviews.Author: Alstromeria33
Reviews.Content: La Griffe, self proclaimed Luxury hotel, fails to meet the target in my opinion. Minimalist design, which seems to mistake minimalist for design. Yet my room was large and I guess I can say that the space was enhanced by the simple lines of decoration. On the bright side: Via Nazionale is a good location for visiting Rome. The hotel has good noise isolation (Rome can be very loud). I stayed on the back side, the courtyard was not charming but quiet. Some rooms are large and roomy. Mine (401) had large bedroom, large bathroom (see pictures) and plenty of storage space. The bed was huge. 2+m I guess. Large and comfortable bathroom, towels warmers, 'massage' shower. Ok amenities. Nice large mirrors throughout the room. Definitely clean (room, bathroom, corridors) On the not so bright side: Only suites have bath (if I understood what I was told, unless that night only available bath were suites ? ). No bathrobes. No tissues. No extra covers and pillows. No coffemate (that seems to be standard in Italy). No clock on bedside (bring yours!) . I expect all these in a luxury hotel. They overdid it with electronics not always with success. The power control (put your hotel key in slot by door) 'died' on me when I was on the other side of the room (bad contact). I had to make it to it in total dark. The sink water is photosensitive, but so little sensitive you can not have water running without keeping a finger on it. TV -no different than in most italian hotel - 70% italian, 30% german, some english (no french). Only BBC was there for me. European sick economicy all evening ... Charming. Room service menu is pathetic (sandwiches and Hamburgers and that sort) The staff is not always very welcoming. I had various experiences. Good and bad. And it felt short of staff. Restaurant food is very decent. Fresh, not overdone, good produce (and wine). A bit expensive (main course, side veggie, glass of wine and coffee : 44 eur). Deserted that night , it has a terrasse with a 'tent' for winter. It is probably very pleasant in the summer. Properly heated in winter. There was a guitare player, alternating with lounge music. There again I think they have not done enough with furniture, decoration and setting (bar and restaurant) to qualify as the lounge of a luxury hotel. Breakfast is a good deal : Nice buffet (english to continental), 10 eur and all the expressos and cappucinos you would want. There again some 'faux-pas' to Luxury : glasses for fruit juice are Ikea! Devil is in the details Mr La Griffe !! In my opinion only worth boarding under their special fares (e.g. not refundable). I don't think they justify the high price.

Reviews.Title: “APPALLING BATHROOM”
Reviews.Author: Julia T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Griffe in Rome for one night at the end of October 2011. We had pre-booked from Australia and pre-paid in excess of A$300 for bed and breakfast. Whilst the room was OK, the bathroom was appalling. A cheap, module shower unit with a grubby shower curtain had been fixed into one corner of the bathroom, the floor of which was flush with the floor of the bathroom, with the result that water from the shower just spilled over the bathroom floor. Several tiles were missing from the shower floor, however, worst of all, a thick ring of mould and slime marked the demarcation between the so-called shower stall and the rest of the bathroom. There was one tap in the bathroom basin for cold water - no hot water. Furthermore, in order to activate the tap, one had to press a small black button at the base of the tap to get a short flow of [cold] water - it took us a while to realise the purpose of the black button. A complaint call made to reception about the slime around the shower and the tap in the basin resulted in a porter with limited English ability being sent up - he stared blankly at the tap and then just shook his head when the slime was pointed out to him. He left, muttering in Italian. Some time later, reception called to ask if we needed a cleaner - we said no - it was late and we were fed up with having to endure such appalling facilities, nor did we want the intrusion of cleaners in our room at that time of night. On check-out the next morning, I again registered our complaint with the male receptionist who scratched a few words on a torn off piece of paper - clearly the matter would go no further. Ian & Julia, Gold Coast, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Location was great”
Reviews.Author: Pumpkin20
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic. You step out of the door and you are ready to experience "Rome. Our room was interesting - it had a see through spiral staircase to the upper level to our bedroom and bathroom. The staff where very helpful - breakfast was more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, good service from reception staff but the restaurant was awful”
Reviews.Author: Travel G
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was spacious, clean and the balcony was large. The reception staff were very very helpful and would go out of their way to assist us. The hotel overall was modern and well equipped. Great location in the centre of everything many restaurants and shops nearby. The restaurant staff that served breakfast were rude, un helpful and not attentive. The breakfast was also nothing special for a 5 star hotel. 1 type of eggs that werent that fresh, bread and juice had run out both mornings and were not replenished. Took the staff half an hour to take our drink order also. Other than the restaurant I would stay again at this hotel it was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “A real mixture of excellent and odd”
Reviews.Author: Kitty1955
Reviews.Content: Great location. Huge and really comfortable bed, but in a room so small that there was no space to put our suitcases. Beautiful bathroom but the fancy shower was so strong that it blew the shower door open and flooded the place (which on examination of the state of the decoration at floor level had clearly happened many times before). Lovely breakfast but we always had to ask staff for the coffee rather than them asking us. The lifts were extra-slow, luckily we were on the second floor so could walk up and down the stairs but the lighting was so dim it was almost dangerous.

Reviews.Title: “Funny little place”
Reviews.Author: Heidi K
Reviews.Content: Look, this place is not 5 star but it is not terrible either. Everything is just a little bit odd. We arrived at 5:30am after an international flight and were told we could check in after breakfast. Not so much - our room was ready after 2pm but we were offered a glass of wine! The shower leaked and flooded the bathroom but was cleaned daily by the cleaners. Hair dryer nearly electrocuted me (sparks were flying when it was turned on) and the hot water was extremely temperamental. HOWEVER, the location is FABULOUS. And breakfast on the roof top was divine (the restaurant staff are lovely). And the view is sensational. I think this place is expensive, but if you can get a good deal online, it could be worthwhile as the location is brilliant. Sevice is friendly but they don't seem to accomplish anything. Lots of Italian men standing around not doing much - but all of them are smiling!!!

Reviews.Title: “No Elevators”
Reviews.Author: Nev7
Reviews.Content: Location was good-near tourist attractions,shops,restaurants & public transport. Appearance and cleanliness of hotel was good.Our room was a junior suite-it was on 2 levels with sitting room/bathroom on lower level and bedroom-ensuite on upper mezanine level linked by private elevator. However, private elevator was out of commision with large jagged tear in wall of elevator shaft.Stairs were steep,spiral-not suitable for carrying a suitcase up and down.The 2 public elevators stopped working for the last 2 days of our stay (we were on 6th floor). Signs were posted indicating this after several hours, but by this time most guests had wasted time waiting for elevators that did not arrive. No apology or compensation was offered for inconvenience. I observed other guests checking in and then being given no assistance getting their bags to their rooms. Our room was large but sparsely equipped.There was on television on upper level ,but not on the lower level where the sofa/table was located (strange). Television was difficult to use and would not always access the hotel services menu. Our room had a small barfridge but no coffee/tea making facility,no corkscrew / wine bucket.The bed was king size but only had 2 pillows (it took 2 days and 3 requests to get more). The sofas were nice leather, but also had no cushions.Bathroom appeared ok but shower head was loose and took some effort to stop it from spraying water onto the light switch. The view from our window was quite pleasant/noise levels were low with windows closed. Breakfast was included with our room and was quite adequate,staff were only there to pour coffee and check our room number (after we were already halfway through our meal). Staff spoke good english,not helpful, but not rude. I would consider this hotel somewhere between 3.5 & 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 5 star and very rude staff”
Reviews.Author: TouristEyes
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Location (it's situated on Via Nazionale which is pretty close to the Termini train station, within walking distance to some attractions and many buses stop along the street) That said, there're plenty of cheaper and nicer hotels along the same street! Cons: - Some of the reception staff were very rude and arrogant. One male staff in particular whom we have had the misfortune to deal with twice was unhelpful and had no concept of good customer service. - Key card did not work and we went to the reception to inform them of this (after not being greeted/acknowledged, we just announced our key card problem to the above mentioned male staff). The male staff completely ignored us, not even bothering to look up. A lady staff eventually helped us and gave us keys to the door. Seems to be a common problem as she wasn't surprised. Why not just fix all the key cards? - Room was tiny with barely any space to walk after laying down our luggages. I know a lot of European hotels have small rooms, but this was ridiculous! I've been to many 3 and 4 star hotels around Europe with much larger rooms than the one offered at this supposed "Luxury" hotel - Bathroom was also tiny without a bathtub - Room missing many amenities and looks tired (though clean enough) - The view we got was of an internal stairwell I wouldn't have rated this hotel so low if not for the fact that La Griffe Hotel had the audacity to call themselves a 5 star "Luxury" hotel and priced it at such. At best, it's probably a 3 star hotel (with bad service). Do not bother! Plenty of other cheaper and better hotels along the same street!

Reviews.Title: “Not a five star hotel - three at best”
Reviews.Author: Linda S
Reviews.Content: This was one of the few hotels available to us for a last minute trip to Rome so we chose 5 star as a safe bet. By five star standards this hotel is poor - tiny rooms, strange decor and average service. By 3 star standards it's fine - good location close to sites, nice roof top terrace and cheap but adequate breakfast. No wi fi in rooms and annoyingly need to get a code every half hour elsewhere in the hotel. Book with eyes wide open!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not a 5-star”
Reviews.Author: AuntieMabel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mother on a short break to Rome. The location is great, close to the metro and bus routes, and within (15 minute) walking distance of the Spanish Steps. It bills itself as a five-star, but I don't think the service or rooms really deserve this. It has a strange black and red colour scheme everywhere which, while on first sight seems quite funky, makes the place a little dingy. The reception staff were efficient enough. Our room was a decent size, on the 8th floor and overlooking the street. The cleaning was patchy and on the second day they left us no towels. The bathroom is large and attractive, with a freestanding bath. However, it was very much a case of design over functionality, as the bath only has a hand-held shower and attempting to take a shower means getting water all over the bathroom floor. They do offer wifi, but only using a password which only lasts one hour (and which you can't log off from, so you can't use it for a couple of ten-minute slots to upload and download emails). Personally I think all hotels should offer free wifi in this day and age. On the Saturday night we went to the bar on the top floor for a nightcap. There were two very raucous parties going on. Which I wouldn't have minded too much if I couoldn't still hear them from my room below once I turned in for the night. So it wasn't a fantastic night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Far from 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: geopalai
Reviews.Content: Clean, nice location, near central train station. That's about all the positive comments I have to write! Employees that can hardly speak english, small rooms, smell from the drainage in the bathroom... And on top of that we get a room with two beds instead of a room with a large bed, not so nice for a couple celebrating wedding anniversary.... and the worst of all no interest to help us with that. At check out we were asked to pay city tax, even though on our voucher was stated "all taxes. The overall impression: Not worth the 200 euros a night, absolutely amateurs, far from 5* hotel

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely not 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: Maryn B
Reviews.Content: I was going to write an impassioned review, but then I decided to just stick to the facts, which are as follows: 1) When I accidentally booked the wrong 3 days at the hotel and arrived a week early, they would not refund my money (that was already charged to my credit card), nor would they give me a credit toward my current stay. 2) The first room they gave us barely fit the king-sized bed and had a window that opened to the internal service stairwell. After haggling with the manager, we were upgraded to a junior suite. Sounds luxurious, right? I was disappointed to find it was only an entry way with a spiral staircase that leads up to a regular single bed hotel room. 3) The shower had crumbling tiles and the drain did not work. 4) The entire bathroom was walled in frosted glass (some privacy please??!!) 5) The linens smelled dirty. 6) There was a half-eaten ham sandwich left in the fridge from the prior guest (no joke). 7) The key card didn't work and we had to call the front desk twice. 8) The rooms and hallways are painted red and dark grey and there is virtually no sunlight to be found in the buidling. To make a long story short, we cut our losses after one night and booked a much nicer room for the same price at the Hotel Quirinale a few buidlings up the street. On a positive note, the manager and one of the front desk girls did try to be accomodating. But if you want a 5 star hotel in Rome, don't waste your time and your money here!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a center”
Reviews.Author: Ara4celi
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a perfect location for a tourist.Metro line A is only short walk and good bus connection to Vatican and Trastevere.The breakfast is great,I liked the restaurant on the 9th floor.The room is comfortable with modern design.The staff is polite and ready to help.I would go back to this hotel any time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Hawker23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a prefect loction to all the sights of rome. Staff are friendly and rooms are clean & tidy. Well worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small room”
Reviews.Author: Wilhelm W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days while exploring Rome. It was a good location for walking around and it was a short walk to a lot of the attractions, such as Colosseum, Circus Maximus and Fontana di Trevi. The bellman was very friendly and gave us a lot of advice on places to see and restaurants. He also helped us book tables at the restaurants. The room was small and had a small, but clean bathroom. Modern style but with signs of wear and tear. Surprisingly good breakfast with all you need (as a northern European at least..). We did not have breakfast on the balcony, which many seems to appreciate, but in a small cellar which was not so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location !”
Reviews.Author: SouthAfricaBella
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is superb, just step outside into the streets which are abundant with shops, boutiques and cafes. Hotel is clean, medium sized room and good bathroom. Color scheme is very bold. Breakfast was mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY”
Reviews.Author: Erin R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Griffe Hotel for two nights the beginning of September and it was wonderful. We had two beautiful rooms, spacious (bigger than most I've stayed in Italy) and nicely decorated. Breakfast each morning was included and was quite sufficient. The staff at the hotel were great, recommending restaurants close by for dinner, made the reservations for us, advised us on the best way to travel, i.e. metro, taxi, etc. When we wanted to do a night time tour, they called and arranged it for us and event held the bus at the hotel until we got back from dinner which lasted a little longer then we thought it would. All in all, a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Holidayer8791
Reviews.Content: I booked this through wotif.com and it was rated 5 star but I felt it was more like three star. If they'd said it was three star and I'd paid three star prices, I would have been quite happy with the experience but there is an expectation when a hotel lists itself as 5 star. The location was good but like other reviews (wish I'd read them before I booked), some staff were rude and smug (apart from a friendly doorman) and the room was poor. I'd be interested to know how La Griffe thinks it is 5 star when it has: corridors with bubbling lino floors peeling paint on walls only one pillow per person on bed cheap linen no clock/radio no shower gel no conditioner no shower (just a shower head that one has to hold over the bath) no glasses - just plastic disposable cups Small rooms with no views Dark and dingy decor

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!”
Reviews.Author: 460Aussietraveller11
Reviews.Content: The only thing we found good about this hotel was the location and 1 of the doormen. We had booked and paid for 3 nights otherwise we would have left after the 1st night. The reception staff were arrogant to the point of rudeness. The keycard for our room rarely worked, we had to keep going down to get the porter to open our door for us. The room was nicely furnished but a kingsize bed left no room to move and the shower and toilet cistern leaked badly so the bathroom floor had to be covered with towels. We booked into the Mascagni around the corner after that and had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't recognize the problems - great hotel on a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: appelsap a
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome in January 2011 and spent 2 nights in La Griffe. I have read some of the reviews, but I don't recognize any of the problems. OK, the standard rooms may be a bit small (but the beds were huge). I loved staying in La Griffe. We had nice rooms, a clean bathroom that was cleaned every day. Fresh towels every day, nice and big breakfast room with helpfull breakfast staff. What I don't get is that people complain about diner in La Griffe. You're in Rome, people!!! Rome is filled with nice restaurants), and then you'll eat in the hotel restaurant? Okay, my summary: + Perfect, wonderfull location on one of Rome's main streets, Via Nazionale + Clean rooms, clean bathrooms, fresh towells every day + Good beds + Good breakfast - Standard room is a bit small for such a large bed

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE. HORRIBLE and I was double-charged.”
Reviews.Author: Helen P
Reviews.Content: I would never stay at this hotel again. I booked the hotel on Orbitz.com and the concierge told me that they did not receive the confirmation. However, when I returned to NY and checked my credit card statement, I saw that I was charged by both Orbitz.com and La Griffe. Furthermore, my room was so small that there was barely enough space to walk around the bed. There was no view and no window. Also, the bathtub got flooded and it took the staff over half a day to fix this. This is certainly not a luxury hotel and I would not recommend anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the bad reviews. This hotel is very good.”
Reviews.Author: Dazzler98
Reviews.Content: Not a true 5 star hotel - more like a very good 3 star. Service is excellent. Find Joseph the concierge for excellent tips on where to see/go. All staff friendly and food in restaurant was good. We went half board which caused confusion but saved us a fortune. (Warning - Rome is extremely expensive to eat and drink in). Rooms - spotless and beds changed daily. Reception staff bent over backwards to help. Location is central and easy walking to Colosseum and Spanish Steps. Great hotel. No hesitation to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “SO DISAPPOINTED!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sa3mmy
Reviews.Content: DO NOT COME TO THIS HOTEL IF YOU WANT ANY SORT OF A SPECIAL EXPERIENCE. I booked this hotel as a honeymoon present for my brother and his wife. They arrived around 10 ish and were given a twin bed junior room view to a wall scaffolding. I am so gutted that there honeymoon had such a horrible start. After phoning Lastminute.com they were upgraded to a deluoxe suite with shower very basic bathroom. They are still there because it was SO expensive but I'm mortified that they re just counting the hours to come home. I wish they could be descent enough to take care of the small things to make it a special experience for customers. So sad.

Reviews.Title: “The same sheets for 5 days. Begging for a second towel!”
Reviews.Author: MariaAthens44
Reviews.Content: Only the location can be mentioned as a positive feature of this hotel. The room service is awful. We stayed at the 7th floor. Housekeepers were coming to clean the room at 15.30-16.00 in the afternoon or were not coming at all. Once, they left us only one body towel. We asked four times (between 18.00 and 23.00) at the reception. Nothing came. The following day no cleaning at all was held in our room. We had to raise the tone of our voices in order to get the essentials. Don't book in this hotel. Absolutely DON'T!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful,elegant brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: dorly
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay for couples. Great area breakfasts are lively

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE - STAFF LIES AND STEALS”
Reviews.Author: dijashaikh
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE This is a horrible hotel with horrible management who simply DO NOT know how to talk to customers!!!!! I plugged my computer into the wall socket when I was told there was only internet in the lobby and unplugged the lamp, immediately the receptionist verbally attacked me and said that I was not allowed to touch anything and that I broke the lamp ( the lamp was working perfectly fine and the socket was broken from before ) he started screaming at me that I am lying and I broke the socket. I calmly explained to him that it was broken from before and perhaps he was mistaken or had not checked it recently, this further enraged him....long story short they tried to make us miss our flight and then said that we ordered bottles of wine and drinks to the room (which we never did) and SCREAMED at us to pay up..................... AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms vary so much”
Reviews.Author: BrownRB
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in June as part of a bus tour group. After discussing our rooms with other passengers on the tour we realized that although we all paid the same amount for the tour each room varied widely. One single gal was put into a suite and we were put into a room so small that we could not both walk between the bed and the TV - I'd say 160 square fee at best, including the bathroom with a shower so small that the glass door would open if you bent over (I'm 140 pounds soaking wet). That said, the room was clean and the location was great. Lots of restaurants to go to and tourist attractions close by. If you stay here the key thing is to immediately ask for a better room if you get put into one of the tiny rooms - trouble is, the hotel may be full up due to the tour operators taking up so many of them.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it too”
Reviews.Author: rixy78
Reviews.Content: La Griffe was a great hotel. The location was fantastic. We walked everywhere and it was never more than 10-15 mins to most of the sights (other than the Vatican). The room was clean and tidy. The terrace was an added bonus, loved having breakfast over looking the roof tops of Rome and the dinner we had there was good too. The best bit were the staff. They could not do more to help with anything from booking taxis to arranging days out or places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Hell + Maids Defecate in Your Toilet and Don't Flush!!”
Reviews.Author: DianeM5
Reviews.Content: We aren't hard to please. All we ask for is what you advertised and what we paid for. La Griffe Hotel was a nightmare, start to finish! Advertised as a 5-Star Hotel, we expected 4-Star as we were told the ratings were different in Europe. This hotel is barely 2 star, and due to the horrendous incidents that occurred, we are giving it a very generous 1 star, but only because there is no option for ZERO stars!!! 1. The comforters are feather filled, they have no other choice. The comforter in mine and my husbands room did not even have a duvet cover on it -- There were feathers everywhere (and we are allergic)! I pulled off the sheet that was covering it -- to find HOLES EVERYWHERE! These holes were covered with STICKERS! PAPER STICKERS! And they were all PEELING OFF REVEALING HOLES AND FEATHERS FLYING EVERYWHERE. I stopped counting at 45 holes! This is what goes against your body as you are sleeping! Rough paper stickers! I called the front desk and they barely understood what I was saying. I finally got them to take them away, but they had nothing to replace them with, other than scratchy wool blankets, which we got for both our room and our kids' room. ALSO... they do not use top sheets! Only a bottom sheet! I asked for TWO SHEETS for each bed, and finally got them, only to find the next day, the maids had removed them along with the blankets.!! So on day two, we had to go through the entire process of getting blankets and sheets again, and only ended up getting 2 blankets for our kids rooms, none for ours!! For our entire 5 night stay, we slept without a comforter and in my room also without a blanket! 2. On our 2nd day, while the maids were putting on the 2nd sheet we requested, my husband and I stood in the bathroom in order to be out of their way (the rooms are SO TINY AND CRAMPED two people can't pass each other around the bed which fills the whole room - you can't even use the drawers in the closet because they can't open due to the nightstand being in front of them!). Anyway, something SMELLED... REALLY BAD! My husband opened the toilet lid to find that the MAID HAD POOPED IN OUR TOILET AND DIDN'T FLUSH IT! We were outraged, and called the front desk but of course they did nothing about that either! So at this point we had to ASK for "do not disturb signs" and put them on our door, and had to refuse maid service for the remainder of our 5 day stay -- we did NOT want them taking our sheets away again and not replacing them, and we did NOT want them defecating in our toilet and not flushing it!!!!! OTHER ISSUES WHICH MADE THIS NOT A 5 STAR ESTABLISHMENT: 1. We sent out a bunch of items to them for DRY CLEANING. We had to go ask for them the next evening as they never returned them. They said "we don't have them here, we'll go get them." 2 Hours later they brought them up... FOLDED not on hangers... and they were SOAKING WET!!! DRY CLEANING SOAKING WET???? Silk tops, ruined! We had to hang everything to dry and were without the clothes we needed for 2 more days! 2. Curtains falling off the track. 3. NO soap dish, soap scum everywhere. 4. Shower stalls in BOTH our rooms leaked and completely FLOODED the bathroom floors! 5. Mini bars practically empty. 6. TV reception unwatchable, only CNN in English. 7. NO TISSUES! THEY DO NOT STOCK TISSUES IN YOUR ROOM AT ALL! 8. NO SPARE TOILET TISSUE! RAN OUT AND HAD TO ASK FOR IT. 9. Our room was across the hall from the maids station/room -- they were CONSTANTLY noisy and loud laughing and talking early in the morning and late at night. 10. Room Service - the food was ICE COLD.. cold burgers, cold french fries. 11. CLEANLINESS: While basically clean looking on the surface... look under your bed! In both of our rooms it was completely dusty and filled with feathers from the leaking comforters! 12. INTERNET: They charge 10 euro per day per computer. You have to go down to the desk to get a code. The code will run out in a few minutes - you have to go get another one... we went through this so many times it was ridiculous! 13. I left a small jewelry pouch behind and realized it after I got to the airport. Although they agreed to send it to me, they made me give them my credit card number to pay for it. I've had several other hotels who ship it to you for free... it arrived yesterday, and I am missing one of my gold earrings. 14. STAFF: The front desk staff was very unhelpful, and mostly rude. They acted as though they didn't understand a word we said, and the most they did for us was say: "The manager isn't here, we'll tell him tomorrow." One of the doormen on our last day - we told him we needed a station wagon to take 4 people and 4 suitcases to the airport... he called for one and it arrived -- a mini car! We were late getting to the airport! The front desk manager agreed to drop our extra charges, for the internet and mini bar, but they would not compensate us for one room which we felt would have been fair due to the MAIDS POOPING IN OUR ROOM, having no covers and sheets on our bed for 5 days, having to deal with floods each morning from the shower, etc. etc. etc.!!! THE ONLY SAVING GRACE for our vacation in Rome was JOSEPH, the DOORMAN!! What a WONDERFUL knowledgeable and KIND man he is! Joseph made us feel special, he would recommend a good restaurant and call ahead to let them know we were coming. He completely catered to our needs. He made us smile when we felt like crying over how we were treated by this horrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “3* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: angelawadhams
Reviews.Content: Clean with decent coffee and the front of house staff are very nice. That's the positives, sadly though the hotel does not meet expectations and is by no stretch of the imagination any where near a 5*, 3* is much closer to the mark. The owners have attempted to be contemporary but what you actually get is cheap and impractical. Everything is just too difficult from taking a shower to storing your belongings. If you're looking for a place to literally lay your head you should be fine, but if you're seeking somewhere a little bit special, keep looking. Hotel Grand Minerve comes highly recommended. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Are You Kidding”
Reviews.Author: MFK6
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the worst place I have ever stayed since college days.....a long time ago. They put on a facade of being a five star hotel but I couldn't find anything about the place even approaching two stars. The room was redone using melamine for the floors & walls. They tried to make it look very modern with glass, mirrors, lights & metal circular stairs. There were so many light switches.....after five nights I still had not found how to make the bathroom light turn off at night. This "room" was actually on two levels with hard slick leather furniture & no TV on the bottom floor. Upstairs was a bed & TV & very small bath. The toilet & bidet were placed so that you could hardly stand & get your leg into the shower. Forget stepping out...it was downright dangerous. The shower head was defective with water shooting straight out from the sides....water temp & pressure went constantly up & down - cold to blazing hot. There was no way to control this, it seemed a function of the entire water system not individual controls. As an older woman; the upstairs only bath was a real problem after a long day of walking. The bed was so hard it was uncomfortable and they cheated on the sheets....there was a bottom sheet & then only the duvet covers...no top sheet if that was what you wanted. The two pillows were already flat from use. There was artwork on the walls that looked as though the manager's 5 year old had done it as a craft project. The furniture was cheap laminated stuff with no character. The decor looked as if a 20 year old Italian boy had dreamed it. I only asked for two wake up calls during my stay - neither one was ever completed by the hotel staff. They did call the male in our party! Because of the melamine decor; the rooms were dank....yes that is the right word - dank. The elevators were so dark that one had to use a flashlight to find the floors - this was during the entire stay. The hallways were done in the same melamine type finish with small lights in the floor. At night they turned off the overhead lights and you had to navigate by the small floor lights. The electronic keys did not work properly. Sometimes it took more than five minutes to manipulate the door lock - hope you didn't have to use the bathroom. Staff was aware of this problem. If they were going by & saw you at your door they quickly used their master card & unlocked your door. Why not just fix the cards they give supposd guests? There was no coffee shop, or small restaurant connected with this hotel. There was a large restaurant with standup small bar on the top floor which was constantly rented out for parties for people in the neighborhood. The night we arrived at 11 p.m. a huge group of teenagers were wandering around the hotel from a party there. They had a concierge desk but when asked for a menu for room service from the restaurant I was told they did not have one and I would have to go to the ninth floor & get my own. Another thing....most hotels change money for their guests...during my five day stay we were told day after day that they just didn't have any money. The bellmen & doorman hung by the front door and outside smoking. The best thing was the delivered continental breakfast (with a $5 per room charge for delivery). I actually cannot say anything else good about this place. Never stay there!!!! They are a racket & just put up a front as a good hotel. The owner has been in place for four years from what I could gather from staff......you would think by now they would know what a five star hotel really looks like. Certainly not some young guys idea of a slick place to shack up with his girlfriend. Other guests I met during my stay had the same and worse problems with getting the most miniscule service achieved.

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating”
Reviews.Author: fhfuentes
Reviews.Content: I stayed in La Griffe for 3 days in June with my mother in a wheelchair. They were very accomodating with getting her a room that was the most accessible possible. Breakfast was excellent and the staff were warm and inviting. The rooms were spacious as well. Water was not as warm as we would have liked, but this is my only gripe. This is a fantastic hotel with great staff and stellar location.

Reviews.Title: “Best week of our life!”
Reviews.Author: DanielRome2011
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at room 808 from 15th of June till 22nd of June. The location of the hotel is great as we were in the center of Rome, where we could easily walk to all the highlights in Rome. Our room was great, very big and comfy beds. Clean room. Great view from our window. Reception desk personnel was very friendly and inviting. The hotel itself looked great from the outside as well as the inside. Personnel in the Hotel was very friendly, helpful and always up for a chat. Their English proficiency was good but sometimes difficult to understand, but they really try their best. The breakfast on the roof of the Hotel was amazing, everytime we ate there we felt amazed! Personnel serving coffee and tea were very friendly and helpful. Didn't bother taking pictures of us if we asked them to. There was a good variation of food, scrambled eggs - bacon - bread - cereal - fruit - sweets - jus d'orange etc. It was very relaxing to eat on the roof with the sun shining and looking at an amazing view of Rome. We want to thank Josef the doorman who was, in our eyes, the heart and soul of the hotel. Everytime we entered or left the hotel, Josef welcomed us with a big smile and really showed interest in us as a person, not a customer. When we go back to Rome, and we will, we will certainly go back to La Griffe! We want to thank everyone who made our stay in La Griffe an unforgettable one!

Reviews.Title: “Incompetent”
Reviews.Author: Mark50
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is a nice looking property in a good section of Rome but are they ever incompetent. We stayed there as part of a tour group for two nights in late May 2011. The air conditoning rattled loudly all night keeping us up. We requested a repair that did not occur. Then the night before check out, we couldn't retrieve our passports and cash which were placed in the room vault. The hotel could not release the vault and actually expected me to vacate the room the next morning without my passports and they would deliver it and our cash to the next city. You must be kidding. I had to beg and argue with them to break open the vault that night after two hours of trying to open it between 10pm and midnight, Finally, they agreed to remove the vault from the room and break it open that night. You can't make this up.

Reviews.Title: “LA GRIFFE- PLEASURE OF AMAZING PALACE”
Reviews.Author: yoramsu
Reviews.Content: Five days of amazing pleasure with high incredible service of all the staff especially- MR,Mazimiliono Maurisios!!!!!!!!!!!!!! best location, large stylistic clean room, very Comfortable bed delicacy breakfest on the roof with . all of it is great experiance to stay in hige quality palace with imperial services!

Reviews.Title: “Spot on”
Reviews.Author: Joeandlauren1
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. Great location for all major tourist attractions either walking or by metro. Station 2 min walk. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Joseph on the door literally couldn't do enough to help and recommended and booked a great restaurant for us. Room was stunning as was the hotel in general.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: ElisaIsabel
Reviews.Content: The only good thing in this Hotel is the location. people working there have no idea of anything, and they speak really bad english. I will NEVER be back in this hotel, in fact I will write a complaining form. This is NOT a 5* hotel, 3 * with luck. Rooms are smelly and dirty, plastic glasses in the rooms, minibar dirty, very noisy, cheap paper napkings in the breakfast room...... Terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: midwestmOm41
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. It is not well-marked from the street, making it hard to find if walking from the train. The breakfast buffet was delicious and served beautifully. The rooms were large and clean. The king bed was the biggest bed we ever saw. For a five-star hotel, there should have been more than one English TV channel and internet service should have been free of charge in the room. Also, we felt that the people working in the hotel were a bit snooty.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, good hotel but it depends how much you pay for it”
Reviews.Author: 18Octave
Reviews.Content: Located close to all the things you want to see the first time you are in Rome. 10 min walk from Fontana di Trevi and the Spanish steps and 15 min walk from the Colloseum. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and helpful, overall the service was very good. However, when you negotiate the price for the room, you need to have in mind that this is not really a 5 star hotel. If you choose the hotel, ask for a side, high floor room, as the main street in from is noisy. So, I would recoment the hotel but you should not pay it for a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this dreadful, uncaring rip-off hotel”
Reviews.Author: JamesOfBoxmoor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is difficult to find because the name is written in illegible sctipt. The interior decor is black. The flippant receptionist asked for our passports and credit cards "so I can clone them". We had paid a lot of money in advance and were shown to a room the size of a shoe box with no view. When I complained, we were offered a "free upgrade" and moved to "the only other option" - a slightly larger room that seemed to be underground because its window outlook was onto a tiny space, surrounded by blank walls that went up many floors, making it impossible to see the sky. In that small space was a scaffolding in which three men started noisy mainenance work at 6am. Next door to our room was the laundry processing area, which began trundliing trolleys at 05:30am. There was no ambient lighting - it was either bright or off. The toilet and bidet were not securely fastened to the wall, and so creaked alarmingly when one sat on them. The hotel did not supply tissues. We overslept one morning because in this room you could barely tell if it was day or night, causuing us to arrive at breakfast just 20 minutes before it closed. When I asked for more coffee just after breakfast closing time, I was told I would have to pay additionally for it. When we checked out, nobody even bothered to ask how our stay had been. This is how we celbrated my milestone birthday and my wife's first visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: nyamnyama
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is definitely not a 5 star. The receptionist was very rude, the room (junior suite!) was really uncomfortable, the conditioning was broken. When we wanted to book a taxi to the airport they said it's 50 euros standard price - while if you take it by yourself - it's 30 euros. So I assume they charge you 20 euros just for calling. The breakfast was awful - on the last day I got food poisoning. Also, there is no Wi-Fi! On the positive side, the restaurant upstairs is actually quite nice and the room service is also good.

Reviews.Title: “It was like having family in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Raustabout
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great - the staff not only served, they went above and beyond time after time. The rooftop restaurant was great. Hotel is walking distance from most of the big spots in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's my first review even though I use this site a lot. This is not 5 star. Maybe 3 star max! A lot of the rooms the ventilation is not working. Room was a sauna! The rooms themselves arent great! It's a good location but that is it! If your looking for cheap low budget hotel and don't mind 40 degree room temperatures that is central this is for you!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, great staff, ideal location. This is a boutique style hotel not a holiday inn type.”
Reviews.Author: daisyk19
Reviews.Content: I had this hotel booked for a present and when I read reviews was dreading staying. Upon arrival we were welcomed by staff, we were there at 9.30am although checkin 2pm we were offered coffee and our bags were taken. They gave us a map of the area and useful info about our surrounding area. We were within minutes walk from all major sights. The metro was 200 yards up the road. 4 euros for 24hr pass. We returned at 2pm to find everything ready in our suite. We had booked superior room but hotel staff gave us suite upgrade free. Very nice superking bed . Bathroom had great shower but no bath. The first night we ate in restuarant ok but such a beautiful dinning area could be wonderful with a good menu. Staff very attentive good service just needed better food. Breakfast was usual streaky bacon, eggs, fruit, rolls, continental breakfast. Joseph the doorman booked us a great place to eat the next night. All staff here very helpful and polite. I would recommend this for city break.

Reviews.Title: “Worst then miserable.”
Reviews.Author: carmengauci
Reviews.Content: I never thought I would be writing a review let alone a negative one !! My husband and I arrived on friday and left Sunday. The staff was ok but one receptionist was totally disinterested. On one occasion he asked us if we needed a restaurant and he suggested one ( the root to arrive to this restaurant was complicated ), so we settled for another just a few meteres away from the hotel ). On returning to the hotel he immediately asked us if we went eating were he had suggested, when we told him we didn't want to walk long distances, his face blankened no expression ( total disinterest ). So after that we went to bed at about 22:00 o'clock someone knocks almost inaudibly, before we know it a man entered the room ( I know its a man because he muttered something before entering ), we answered him as best we could ( half asleep ) and he closed the door abruptly behind him. Needless to say I felt very unsettled and unsafe bearly closed my eyes. When I phoned reception the guy told me it must have been the technician. What in the world was a technician doing opening our hotel door ?? The airconditioner did not work well on one occasion we had to phone to complain 3 times so the reception lowers our heating system it was too hot. We asked him to lower to 16 degrees and still the room was very warm ( definitely not 16 degrees ). Now I am one who feels cold !!! Lastly on arriving home I open my luggage to find my pygamas were not in the luggage. Now it can't be stolen from the airport cause we used the speedy boarding process and our luggages were always the first to come out. Our locks were not tampered with. I would not recommend this hotel, some of the staff were very cordial but all in all there is a very unsafe air around this hotel. I wrote to the hotel complaining but to this day no one answered. Shame on them !!

Reviews.Title: “Avarage hotel but surely not 5 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: funny2222
Reviews.Content: It was quite expensive to stay, but definitely not 5 stars hotel as they told u, more like 3 stars hotel. The only benefit it's located very strategic places, basic bfast not so much choices. The doorman talking most of the time to the guests but not really working. Few TV Channels avail, All TV Channel are in Italian, only 1 is in English. No wifi, u got to pay for the internet connection. The room card were fault, so difficult to open the door. We spent 2 nights there. Next to it is a church so we often hear long noisy bells church which takes quite long :p for short city trip like us it was ok. But dont expect fancy hotel if u stay there.

Reviews.Title: “a great memory i will never ever forget”
Reviews.Author: Captain-Alqahtani
Reviews.Content: it was my first time in Rome..i was so lucky to book on this hotel, it was indeed above my expectations.the staff were very friendly , food was good & the location is just perfect.loved the staff welcome & goodbye smiles.my stay was so comfortable up to a point i felt i was home.i would relay recommend this hotel and if i have a chance again to visit Rome for sure it would be this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: RebecaH
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights for our honeymoon during a five week trip around Europe. It was a fantastic location but the staff were not welcoming or particularly helpful and the room was average. Our room key was faulty and internet did not work. We asked the front desk three times if they could print for us details for a day tour we had booked, and each time were told they were too busy. It was very noisy making it difficult to sleep and the shower was terrible (constantly fluctuated between freezing and boiling without touching the taps). It was also the only hotel that did not acknowledge our honeymoon (at all other hotels we received upgrades, rose petals on the bed, wine, chocolates, or a card wishing us well). The hotel should try harder to live up to it's self-titled name of La Griffe 'Luxury' Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Azza25
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our first night in Europe. Got it as a mystery deal on wotif.com but figured which hotel it was before we booked. It was a very good price, even better after staying. We arrived very early as our flight got in at 0530 so our room wasn't ready. The staff were happy to take our bags, let us use the bathrooms and gave us some guidance on the area to have a look around for a little while. We had a walk and a shop and came back, still a little early, and the room was ready. The room was a decent size and was very clean. The heating worked well and the shower was fantastic, especially after a long flight. The staff were excellent. The receptionist was happy to chat for a while and gave us a map of the city with plenty of directions and ideas for where to go. We were only in Rome for one night as we are returning later in our trip, but this hotel was walking distance from all the major attractions, and close enough to the main train terminal to walk, even with our luggage. We haven't used a taxi yet. We had a great stay here. Our only complaint was the internet access. The hotel charged 4 Euro for one hour of access and it was quite slow most of the time. Other hotels offer free access with much better speed, but don't let this put you off. It's still a lovely hotel with friendly and helpful staff. I accidentally took the lift to the wrong floor, but caught a glimpse of the view from the restaurant and it looked great. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Very unusual but interesting room laysout”
Reviews.Author: SNGV
Reviews.Content: I stayed at La Griffe for one night in Spring 2008. It was quite a pleasant experience. It is well located. The room was very nice. It was a suite in 2 levels. The first level was rather modest, while the second level was extremely comfortable. Special compliments go to rather spacious bathroom. Breakfast was standard, nothing really outstanding. Due to the room layout you don't really get access to the windows. The only downside was noise of water in the pipes in the night. The pipes must have been somewhere in the walls behind the bed. Therefore whenever someone of the neighbours went to bathroom I was awaken with the noise of the water running down the bedroom wall.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: jdubcee
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at law griffe. Originally booked at the mecenate palace, which is no palace so we decided to go elsewhere. Checked out many hotels in the area and decided to go with this one. It is a great location and we got it for a great price. Staff (especially the front office manager, forgot his name) extremely friendly, helpful, and courteous over our 3 day stay. Room was clean, modern, and very spacious. It got too hot in our room at times, but besides that it was great. Very very satisfied with the hotel and would love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stop here! 3 doors down the street there is a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chilettir
Reviews.Content: Central position and apparently nice rooms on the internet site, but in reality average rooms, overpriced for the value and very unpleasant staff. The electricity docket was broken as the television and the telephone. Despite several requests for help, only the TV was fixed after 3 hours and for the other 3 days of the stay nothing else was fixed. We spent NYE in the restaurant upstairs (La Luna) as recommended by the staff, and it was a dreadful experience, we were sited outside in a Gazebo with some heathers; it became very cold and everyone in the same area left before Midnight because of the cold. None apologized. The dinner was pricey and average, definitely not worth it. In conclusion, if you want a central hotel just move 3 doors down the road to the ARTEMIDE Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Just don't”
Reviews.Author: orpheus07
Reviews.Content: Disinterested staff, terribly thin walls, television and phone didn't work and beyond the bellboy bringing a new remote for the tv no real effort was made to address this fact. Restaurant terrible and over-priced. showers over-designed and uncomfortable. bathroom experienced significant flooding from shower. cheaply finished rooms. The bed however was comfortable and the location is good - however the Artemide which is currently ranked number 3 in Rome is just next door - so give that one a go!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel - 4* Business, Definitely not 5*”
Reviews.Author: TRamakrishnan
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the termini station and took a taxi here. Was a quick 5 minute journey and this was in peak evening traffic. So it was definitely a central location. Was a sleek art deco kind of place, hard floors and minimalist furniture, with lots of reds and blacks. Room was small but again in Europe this is to be expected unless you are staying ultra luxury hotels and they are a whole lot more expensive than your average 5* hotel. The bathroom was not in the greatest condition and the room itself was a little rundown. As such the hotel is not very well maintained. The breakfast was pretty rubbish with some of the worst food I have eaten in my life, let alone in Italy where even bad food is generally decent. While it is not as bad as some of the reviewers make it out to be, it is not a hotel to visit if you are looking for a nice place. What the La Griffe is, is a 4* functional business hotel in a central location

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Kups1983
Reviews.Content: This is definately not a 5 star hotel, only way to descibe it - weird!! Not impressed with the room, noisey from the road, air-con made a noise when on, shower didn't work properly, the list goes on. The only positive point is the location. Will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel La Griffe: the good package!”
Reviews.Author: Nabil68
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 3 nights at Hotel La Griffe in Rome. It was a very nice stay. The location on via Nazionale is very good : very close to train station Termini and the beautiful piazza della Repubblica (where you can take metro), you can have a short walk and reach easily Santa Maria Maggiore (and then the Roman Forum) or Piazza di Spagna and then Villa Borghese. Many buses take you directly from via Nazionale to Piazza Venezia or Piazza Navona or Vaticano. The area is excellent for shopping at a good rate quality/price (especially for clothes, bags and shoes). You have even a huge bookstore and a nice football store just in front of the hotel. The classical style facade of the hotel is very beautiful, and when entering, you are charmed by the interior design which is tasteful and unexpectedly modern. Our room was very clean and had a very beautiful romantic red-coloured modern design. The bathroom is also nice but needs only an accessory for the soap. The terrace on the ninth floor is a very charming place for breakfast or dinner (the restaurant is good) as you have a panoramic view of Rome. Last but not least : the staff is so nice and helpful (Lorenzo is so elegant and Giulia so sweet and professional ! ). Also the doormen are so kind and helpful, they crossed the street to help us with our luggage as we were leaving the hotel and the taxi was waiting by the other sidewalk. Molte Grazie e ...Arriverderci !

Reviews.Title: “It's not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsGlobetrotter70
Reviews.Content: We spent a little less than 2,000 EUR for what was supposed to be a suite: nothing like that! I need just say that in the bathroom there were two PLASTIC glasses next to each sink, and mold at the corners of the bathtub!! The petit bottle of champagne in the minibar tasted corky and costed 50 EUR, and for the first 2 days of our stay nobody ever replaced the two bottles of water we consumed the very first day! Not to mention the super expensive internet connection (20 EUR/day) for a wireless in the room. This is neither a room, nor a service vaguely appropriate for a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay with upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Saxholme
Reviews.Content: Arrived very late without confirming our stay, think that they might have sold our room as they immediately upgraded us to their best room. Fabulous, unfortunatley we were leaving the next day. We were originally booked in to the cheapest room without breakfast (although if you book on the hotel's site breakfast was included). Paid for breakfast the next day, really good, couldn't fault it. I certainly don't think it warrents being a 5*. We were told that the bar on the roof was open for food and drink until 2 am, we arrived at 1.10 and were turned away. Staff at reception were lovely. Really good locatio

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend this hotel it's the worst I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: corvette1968
Reviews.Content: This trip to europe was because I am dieing. It was on my bucket list. This hotel had mold in bath room,water leaked all throught the room do to lack poor or no maintance. Managers are rude if you have any problem's including maintance problems at night. We had to clean up ous self. Their are electrical problems, entryroom keys, the Elevators did not open or leavel, And on our 2nd to the last day their I asked for a cab the manager sent me to the door man. My wife and I went out to dinner in the cab he called us. When we got their I payed him he jumped in his cab I banged on his door and he looked at me and spead off with my camra, I call the door man he called ( his friend ) and said It was'nt their. When we got back I spoke to manager on duty he said the door man was gone, I asked about fileing a police report I was told it was miles away and at 10:pm no one at the police spoke english, they were very uncaring and unhelpful, The next day I spoke to the doorman his story changed he said the driver found it but someone must have reached in front and grabed it.when I said I was going to the police his story changed again,now he did'nt find it and things happen like that all the time again very uncaring. By now we had no time left as our plane was leaving I spoke to the desk again offering a reward I said I did'nt care about the camere but offered a reward for the photos She said please send a e-mail to the main manager and gave me a e-mail accress I sent one every day for at least 2 weeks with no responce. These photos ment a lot as my time on earth is very short . It had my dreams on them and I wanted to leave my children memorys of me doing what I always dreamed of,and to see me happy in my final time on earth This hotel is heartless, not to mention a 5 star If I could I would gime then a 0 Shame on them. I still e-mailing them but they really don't care Its ovious In a town with their realgious history and where the Pope lives the people their only care about $$$$$ please don't give them your business they would not even give me info on cab company

Reviews.Title: “Ditto - not a 5 star property !”
Reviews.Author: RPDinner
Reviews.Content: Dissapointed with this Hotel. The room especially was claustrophibic(ly) small and wasn't very clean. Dirty marks on the walls and the floors were very dusty. The bathroom was fine but the water pressure in the shower was very weak. The "window" was actually a hatch to the fire escape and air conditioning system which was inches away from the window. The heating system buzzed all night which kept us awake. We asked to change the room on arrival but were refused. On the plus side there is a great roof terrace restaurant/winebar..my recommendation would be though to stay somewhere else and visit the roof terrace for a glass of wine and look at the sunset over the roof tops of Rome. The reception staff were generally supersilious and looked very bored with their job. The restaurant staff on the other hand were friendly and efficient. Decor is over designed with no substance, black and red starkness...all rather late 80's early 90's. Not a very good experience overall unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Rome”
Reviews.Author: SilvB
Reviews.Content: I decided to share my experience at La Griffe Luxury Hotel because every traveler should know that this is one of the best hotels. Once I have arrived at the hotel, everyone was smiling (which is the most important), the door man, the people from reception etc. The lobby and the reception are very modern and stylish. I should say that I received an upgrade to a junior suite (I did not expected because the hotel is fully booked in this time). The room was very nice, exceed my expectations after words, with a lot of amenities (shampoo, bubble bath, soap, toothbrush...etc), and the room was cleaned daily. The breakfast was very good, on the roof of the hotel, but the view is extraordinary.. The location is very good also, closed to the most important sights.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Priced Rome Hotel close to centre”
Reviews.Author: PUREFX
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms 500,600 which are deluxe rooms. Upgraded from a standard. This is a nice hotel in a ok location, about 20min from the spanish steps. 7eur by taxi. Rome is very expensive so we were pleased to find a decent hotel without having to pay an arm and leg. Generally we found the Italians are living on a different planet when it come to pricing. wake up and smell the international competition. Overall this is a good hotel if the price is right.
