GOOD Modern clean rooms with good a/c and quiet. Nice beds but hard hard pillows. Great door man (in the grey coat) Nice staff. Breakfast, nice espresso BAD The bath/with over shower is a great example of design over function. There is no place to put soaps shampoo etc No iron for pressing (according to the front desk very very very dangerous) a silk dress but you can have it pressed for you for 8eurs! Breakfast; no fresh juice. why??? in italy in summer. Americano Coffee (instant) was coloured water. While the location is centralish, after a day walking its a long walk back, so the cost of taxis need to be factored into the location.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: radelm
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, very small room, friend of ours had a bigger room. It was clean, they charge for internet access, 10 euro/ 24 hr. Breakfast was very good, but dinner was terrible. Front desk was no help. No top sheet on bed, I guess there could be worse and this place wasnt terrible. Everything would depend on the price. A little noisy. Hamburger ordered from room service was 20 euro. Cruise ship showers are bigger than the one we had.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: g0lden2010
Reviews.Content: Did not find staff helpful on arrival. The location of the hotel was good. The room was 2 beds joined together, the TV had only 1 channel. Unable to get internet. The bathoom was shabby as the shower had meldew and leaked water all over the bathroom floor. After returning from site seeing we decided to have a drink upstairs and we were set apart from other guests who were having dinner in an area of bushes and cold air. Would not rate the hotel 5 star possibly 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: carina_wiklund
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, clean, amazing breakfast and the staff at the door, specially the man from Ostia was lovely!!! All the staff was helpful and nice.Food at the roof terrace was good and their Irish Coffee....the best i Roma!!!! Our room was OK, a little small.....but...we just slept there, so what?! Me and my grownup daughter were very satisfied, if we´ll return to Roma, La Griffe will be our choice of hotel!!! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star hotel - not helpful front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: missveiga
Reviews.Content: We were recommended to this hotel by American Express platinum. We expected excellent customer service. The hotel is beautiful, the location is good, but the staff are not very helpful. We arrived at the hotel and were hungry, we kindly asked for a recommendation to grab a quick bite near the hotel. The lady from the front desk told us to go to the central station. The central station is not really a nice area to go eat, the streets smell and there are many junkies in the neighbourhood. We read that in our Rome book and totally ignored her recommendation. Then I was talking to another person in the front desk, I was trying to speak Italian and this front desk assistant called Massimiliano started making fun of my Italian. I was just making the effort to speak the local language. I was not happy at all. Even the upgrade to a junior suite (loft) made me forget his bad joke. The following morning we had breakfast in the terrace with a beautiful view. When we tried the food, it was horrible. All the cakes were extremely dried, the pastries were not nice and the juice was not fresh, but from a box. The minimum we can expect from a five-start hotel is a freshly squeezed orange juice. When I asked the waiter, she told me I could order one for 6 euro. You got to be kidding me. Be aware that the hotel is next to a church and the bells will ring at 9am. So if you like to sleep late, please be wise and take some ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice friendly staff - dirty grotty room”
Reviews.Author: knixuk
Reviews.Content: I was quite looking forward to staying at this hotel when I saw it on the internet, it was reasonably priced and sounded great. When we got to it and entered the reception I still thought it looked great, it looked modern and sophisticated. The porter and hotel staff were very very helpful and polite. On first arriving to the room we both thought it looked very nice and very modern. We were staying in a standard room so nothing too swish in it. The shower looked great, lots of jets and things..... but then we turned it on and only about two of the jets worked. On a closer look around the room it looked dirty and not cleaned very well. The TV didnt work and the "games console" is nothing of the sort... they are basically old mobile phone games like snake. It is a shame because it had huge potential but i have stayed at two other hotels in Rome that were far cleaner and better value for money although the La Griffe had much better staff than any other! Good location though.

Reviews.Title: “No, still not a 5 Star hotel but not bad.”
Reviews.Author: yesnotravel
Reviews.Content: Ok, this is not a 5 star hotel, not even close. But then the pricing is about 1/3 of a real 5 star hotel, that pretty much reflects reality. You can expect 1/3 of the things you would expect from a real 5 star hotel. Stayed: 3 Nights in August 2010 Room: La Griffe Classic (Standard Double Room) Location: Very very good, close to Termini and walking distance to all the "must see" attractions. (Taxi is rather cheap also, by Swedish standards) Staff - Friendly and helpful. Room - Small, not 5 star clean, no changing of sheets during 3 nights, noisy - "people outside the room appear to be in the room", no iron, no tea/coffee, lousy lcd tv with a noisy picture and bad remote control. We consider this room (la griffe classic double) to be a ok modern 3 star room with good A/C. Breakfast - If you like to eat cakes and sweet stuff this is the breakfast for you! There was a lot of fruit which was nice! 4 Diffrent kinds of cereal and a couple of diffrent kinds of youghurt, totally ok. If you like a "normal" (for us) breakfast, there was only 2 kinds of bread of which one was not tasty at all. One type of cheese, but then 3 types of ham/mortadella and turkey. The big plus is that you can eat breakfast on the rooftop with a ok view of rome. Internet - not included (not so 5 star), and one hour of surfing costs 4€. Complimentary stuff - none except soap and schampoo.. Overall we pretty much got what we expected, a nice little hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Thankfully I did not listen to other reviews”
Reviews.Author: fremo101
Reviews.Content: The La Griffe was amazing and the Family room was perfect. It is two stories and has two toilets which for a family is wonderful. It even has a lift to take luggage to the second floor. It is modern, comfortable and was an amazing stay. Service was great and the breakfast location on the rooftop was superb. One of our best accommodations in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTING - NOT WHAT WE EXPECTED FROM A FIVE STAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: TonoandRacho
Reviews.Content: Regrettably my husband and I stayed at this hotel for four nights, only days ago (early August). We wish that we had of read the negative reviews on this website, they were spot on. In hindsight we should have checked out and gone somewhere else. This is NOT a 5 star hotel. It is not a 3 star. At best it is an upmarket backpackers. In fact even one of the hotel staff admitted that in no way was it 5 stars. Below are the problems we encountered. 1. Noisy room. On evenings 1 and 2 we were kept awake until early hours of the morning by the people walking around in the room above, due to poor noise insulation. On the last night a private function was held on the open roof top terrace with a band playing into early hours of the morning. We could hear the band loud and clear from our room. 2. No hot water at 9:15am on two mornings of our stay. 3. The hotel would not provide us with a bathroom where we could have a shower after checking out and waiting for our late night flight back to Australia. This is totally unacceptable. 4. We slept on two single beds pushed together, of which my husband's was on an angle. 5. There was no complimentary internet in the room (a standard feature in 5 star hotels, but not this hotel). 6. The TV did not work correctly. Changing the volume with the remote changed the channel so we could not watch TV. 7. There was no tea and coffee making provisions in the room. A kettle would have been nice. All 5 star hotels have them. 8. There was no iron in the room. 9. The room looked to have been renovated however the standard for a 5 star hotel was very very poor and grubby. I could continue, however won't. We will not be staying at this hotel again or recommending it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend in early July. We booked the hotel before reading the negative reviews on TripAdvisor and had contemplated changing accommodation. However, we decided to "wait and see". Aren't we glad we did?? Firstly, the location is perfect. It's on the busy Via Nationale and only yards from the subway. There are lots of shops, bars and restaurants nearby. The concierge were very helpful when we needed advice on attractions and restaurants. The room was quite large, modern, bright and very clean. Room service was excellent. The room was cleaned every day. Breakfast was delicious. It was on the roof top terrace with amazing views of the city, what a way to start your day!!! We had dinner on the terrace one evening. Again the food was delicious and watching the sun set over Rome was beautiful. I could not recommend this hotel enough. Please ignore the negative reviews and "wait and see", you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel in a fabulous city”
Reviews.Author: Caroline_wright2000
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews about this hotel I was a bit worried about staying here - I shouldn't have worried! The hotel was perfect! We stayed in for my birthday in June so the temperatures were pretty high. It was a real treat to come back to a clean, quiet, cool, air-conditioned room with a HUGE comfy bed! The staff were really helpful, recommending some great restaurants and sights to see close by. Having evening drinks and breakfast on the rooftop terrace was a real highlight with amazing views of Rome and a beautiful bell tower next door. For the price, it's a great hotel and would most definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Absaloutly amazing”
Reviews.Author: niamh9191
Reviews.Content: My sister booked this hotel for her wedding and going on the bad reviews we were slightly worried about the hotel however its services were first class. From arrival to departure the hotel staff were fantastic, they couldn't have done enough for my family and I. The rooms were lovely and cleaned to perfection on a regular basis. The wedding set up was out of this world ( highly recommended) the view of the city of Rome was breath taking and the food was amazing, the staff, particularly at this time were so helpful and friendly to all guests. Everyone who shared this experience would highly recommend this hotel, it really made my stay in rome complete.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lovethesun081
Reviews.Content: Do not be put off by the negative reviews of this hotel. I stayed there for a friend's wedding and it was fantastic. The room was lovely and clean, very modernly decorated. We were upgraded on arrival, free of charge. The staff were so lovely and really could not do enough for us. The wedding was on the roof top and it was amazing, the food and service were both great. The hotel really added to the overall experience of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “SINISTER”
Reviews.Author: bonviva
Reviews.Content: How this Hotel got five stars is beyond belief. We were delayed in Rome due to the volcanic ash. Our room was absolutely awful dark, tacky and noisy. We booked for two nights but ran out to the four star Quirinale hotel which is next store. I would highly recommend this this hotel. We were upgraded to a junior suite which was beautiful. The staff were very helpful and the breakfast was very good. Unlike La Griffe where the breakfast was like the hotel terrible!

Reviews.Title: “viva la griffe”
Reviews.Author: bjr949
Reviews.Content: can't thank the staff at la griffe hotel in rome for our stay.............good rooms good location and would like to have stayed longer. close to all.

Reviews.Title: “Guess we were lucky”
Reviews.Author: turnipfish
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews here I realise that we had an incredible luck with this hotel. We had booked a "classic room" but on arrival we were upgraded to a "junior suite". The room was clean and spacious and had a large window that covered an entire wall with a section in the middle that you could open and a nice windowsil you can sit on an watch the view. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was nice. The internet via the TV never really worked and it costed extra. But we colud use a computer in the reception when we needed fix a couple of things. The so called airconditioning was a bit of a joke. You could set it on 21-23 C and it was mostly noisy but didn't make much difference. We opened the window instead. All in all we had a really nice week at La Griffe, but after reading the reviews here and considering we were upgraded I would probably not recommend La Griffe to anyone. At least not to book anything simpler than a "junior suite"...

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: eitravel
Reviews.Content: We got an inside room with no air, that turn into a sauna after a bath... It was a disaster! When we went to relax a bit in the happy hour and paid 5 euro for coffee and 8 euro for a glass of wine ,,, And there are much more: bugs in the room, frontdesk that can recommend on only one resturant etc. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Poor 5 star hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Roblaois
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel for 2 nights on our recent trip to the magnificent city of rome . Overall I am very dissapointed with this hotel .I thought it was badly finished and had a bad smell of stale water in some of the rooms which when we reported to the reception was never sorted. Our room was not changed as was promised instead they just dismissed us .I am a travel Agent and will not be using this hotel again. As I belive that the management and reception staff have a lot of training to be at 5 star standard which neither themselves or this property are I grade this as Maximum 3*** Superior hotel and service.

Reviews.Title: “Dark and Black!!!”
Reviews.Author: rometripBangalore
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I stayed in this hotel from 28th july 09 to 30th july. After a long drive from Nice, we reached this hotel booked by Thomas Cook. The hotel does not impress you from the road. It has no special elevation or look. When we entered into the lobby (late evening) the lobby was dark with black color, black cloth and small lights to make it more darker. We have to widened our strained eyes to find dark coloured lift door. Not only this, there are mirrors to further confuse you in the dark. I really abhor this type of black color and darkness. I dont know what interior beauty achieved by darkness! It is a common sense to any hotel to lit up its lobby to show its splendor! But this hotel miserable fails. Lift is small. When you reached room, the doors are of Romans' time!!. They dont work properly. The funny part and also scary part is that the room is divided into two with your bed and bathroom upstairs connected by glass steps!!!. You cant lift and take up your lugguage to upstairs with those glassy steps, so you have leave your luggage and cloths down stairs and use bathroom and bed upstairs! For everything you have to climb down and up which makes you exhausted!!!! Some of my colleagues demanded for change of rooms without upstairs. Next day we demanded to change over to some other hotel..... You can imagine when we demanded for change of hotel with Thomas Cook... the mindset of ours and impression about this hotel....When you go to bathroom, though it is fitted with modern fixtures... you have to jump into the bath tub and everything crumbled and jammed. When you wash your face, you feel...God has given you very long hand to make inconvenient...... Its is enough... there are so many negatives...but however only we enjoyed was breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: BoutiqueHotelFan
Reviews.Content: Very well located and very helpful staff! Nothing more to say, come here and enjoy this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Serenity31
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while in Rome as part of a group tour I took in Sept 08. Room was big and spacious with modern amenities. Breakfast on the roof in the mornings were fantastic. Great location for taking a stroll down Via Nazionale for shopping and visiting other sights downtown. Definitely recommend this hotel if staying in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel, I think not!”
Reviews.Author: Smithyx
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th hotel in a 2 month visit to Europe and I have decided to review each one in a in a standard way as suggested by Tripadviser. We stayed here for 7 nights. 1: Describe the service you experienced. The check in and out was relativly easy with a little languge difficulty the reception staff organising our bags to be taken to our room. On the other times we had to ask questions about getting around and such they reception staff were a little lost as their grasp of English was very poor, the most helpful people were the bell boys with special mention to the door men they were a god send with their advice on where to go and not to go, how to get there what to see and all other pieces of information that helped us out immeasurably. These lads on the door provided us with some of the best service we got in our 2 months in Europe. 2: Tell us how you liked the room The room was pretty standard but it did have room for the bags without having to climb all over them, the bar fridge was a joke and it didn’t work it couldn’t even keep the water cold even after we took out the entire mini bar stuff. The main door to our room was warped / bent and if you didn’t slam it wouldn’t lock which made the neighbours happy I’m sure, but it was also an issue of having to check it was closed properly all the time, also our window was right next door to the church steeple and the church bells were quite loud. 3: Talk about the location & amenities Breakfast was served in on the rooftop which was a problem the morning it rained as there was no contingency, was pretty funny watching the waiters trying to keep the buffet breakfast dry. Breakfast was very disappointing with only some cereal and yoghurt, a choice of ham and salami with bread roles, a few cakes and fruit that wasn’t very fresh, and that was it, but as we have discovered its pretty standard fare in Europe. The location is central in Via Nazionale near Piazza Venezia, which is about a 15 minute walk from the main railway station. The distance to all the sites are walkable, see below: There is a super market a couple of blocks down Via Nazionale and there is a Laundrette not far down Via Della Quattro Fontane near Barbarini. Trevie Fountain 15 min Coliseum 40 minutes Vatican and St Peters is about 50 min walk Laundrette and decent internet 10 mins walk The Internet access was via the TV in your room, it was expensive and totally useless, basically it didnt work and the laundrette I mentioned above has internet access which is cheap and with modern fast PCs. 4: Say what you liked best & least Not a lot really, for a hotel to be called La Griffe Luxury hotel it left a bit to be desired, the room and it amenities were disappointing and the breakfast were not flash so whilst its not the worst hotel I have ever stayed in its not what I would expect as a luxury hotel in the heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not as 5 Star as you'd expect for the price!”
Reviews.Author: DavyMac69
Reviews.Content: After always wanting to visit Rome I finally got it booked and decided to opt for the 5 Star treatment, which was over my budget but what the hell! The girl on reception was second to none, she had a cold but was extremely friendly. She handed us a map and took 10 minutes to tell us the obvious sites to see but also a few unknown areas, which without her we would have missed and actually were my favourite nights. We'd been travelling all night but went straight out to experience Roma, got back to the hotel at 6pm to get showered etc when the first problem raised it's head, no hot water. I rang to reception to the answer of "yeah that happens sometimes!" Will it be fixed? Maybe, I don't know!! Will there be anything else sir? Needless to say I was pretty angry!! Different girl from this morning, she couldn't have cared any less!! The water warmed up about an hour later, enough to have a wash in luke warm water. Problem 2, which annoyed me the most was breakfast. I'd paid extra for breakfast to be inclusive, and, after a long first day, a nice breakfast in bed was on the cards. On the card it said "Continental Breakfast WITH croissant and roll, tea or coffee and juice. We got a croissant and pastry and some crappy crispy bread in a packet with the coffee and juice. Rang reception thinking the other tray was missing, "No sir, that's your breakfast!!" No tea & coffee facilites in the room, no pen to fill in the score card & breakfast card, one pillow each which was only an inch thick. On their own web-site it states you have full internet access in your room so I didn't bring my laptop, of course the internet never worked! All in all the only 5 star thing about this hotel is the front and reception. The rest is rubbish and extremely over-priced. I would never reccommend this place to anyone. As is alot of things in Italy, less IS more. Go for something under-stated and more authentic, this place sucks!! Sorry to ramble!! Rome is amazing though, get it booked!! =)

Reviews.Title: “Pretended style, but poor quality”
Reviews.Author: Citrouille
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 days at Hotel La Griffe with a business group and we stayed 2 more days in another hotel for leisure (this choice based on the TA reviews). The 2 hotels have the same prices and the same (good) location, but what a difference of quality! A new evidence of the TA added value. Hotel La Griffe is not really a bad hotel, but we didn’t like it for many reasons: a flashy - modern - style, an unhappy (or not natural) staff, a lot of small details and an evident lack of quality. Evident because a deep discordance exists between the pretended style and the real quality. The room was correct, with an unpleasant bathroom (an old bath in the middle, with disturbing not clean curtains around for the shower). The TV doesn’t work very well, you need to pay for the mini-bar (3 EUR for a small bottle of water) or to use internet,... For Italy, the breakfast is extended. Not really bad, but, here too, with a lack of real quality. All is done to appear luxurious, “high level”, but tastes artificial and gives a poor final product.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars??? I don't think so.”
Reviews.Author: VesK
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with internal view. We had an early morning flight, therefore, checked in at 11am. The staff would not let us check in before 1pm and asked us to come back in 2 hours. When we did check in later, we were really disappointed with the room. It was really warm. We tried lowering the AC temperature but could not change it as it was programmed to be at 22 degrees C at all times. Complained to the reception, only to be told that an engineer would be sent to check the problem. Waited all afternoon, but no one turned up. We got really frustrated and asked to see the manager, who offered to move us to another room but had to wait another day before we could move. 1 thing that really put me off was the rude reception staff. Absolutely no manners on how to treat a guest. It was meant to be a relaxing holiday but ended up really stressed. Overall, Poor customer service!!!! Barely pass as 3 stars. Definitely will be avoiding this place next time.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: hamov
Reviews.Content: Tiny rooms. Dark lobby and hallways. No vent in bathroom. Poor breakfast. Had to pay 70 euros extra/day for "better" room. Mechanical door key does not always work . Small elevator. 20 min walking distance from Rome attractions. Mostly middle eastern and African staff with poor manners.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars for service, 5 stars for location.”
Reviews.Author: garrad
Reviews.Content: The Good: * Location is within walking distance to so many interesting parts of Rome. * Breakfast is very nice on the rooftop terrace (in good weather). * Very efficient housekeeping. The Bad: * We experienced some terrible service from the staff, although there were exceptions to this. * Requested double room and got two twin beds. * No remote control in room upon arrival. * No bedside table. * Hotel design is like a brothel, with a lot of black and red. * Asked concierge to make a restaurant booking and when we arrived at the restaurant they didn't know anything about it. Overall, I think this is a 4 star hotel at best. The owners are obviously trying to pass it off as 5 star, but there is very little of the quality service that I would ordinarily associate with a 5 star hotel. The rooms are not refined, the staff are mostly rude or inept, the design of the hotel is distasteful. I would only recommend this hotel for its location. I think you could probably find a better hotel billing itself honestly as a 4 star or even 3 star hotel elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: ellamalta
Reviews.Content: We booked a superior double room for one week. The room they gave us at first was quite small, definitely not a superior, but on our complaint, they were very understanding (we were travelling with a toddler who needed space to move around), and gave us a beautiful room with a terrace. All the staff at the reception were very helpful. The doormen were very attentive and helpful as well. The breakfast was plentiful and of good quality. The rooms were very modern and clean. Nothing to complain about. Was expecting much worse from the comments seen on ta. Would definitely recommend this hotel. It is situated in a central location, very close to bus and train stations, but still in a nice busy area.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star my [--]”
Reviews.Author: Ironbutts
Reviews.Content: Go for the rooftop restaurant and sax player but avoid the hotel at all costs!!!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel we've stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: WeeninEngland
Reviews.Content: It was described as a five star, luxury hotel but I'd give it 3 stars at best. Our room was about 10 x 10 foot and you could just about walk around the bed. Our view was an internal fire escape, which let no light in as it was surrounded by a brick wall. We kept the curtains closed so we didnt depress ourselves! The bathroom was tiny and you could only get to the toilet if you closed the door first because it was only about 4 foot wide. When we checked in we were told that our room wasn't ready and they showed us a suite for an upgrade price of £400 (over 3 nights!). When we said no because it certainly didnt warrant the cost they wanted, our room suddenly became available. The decor is depressing.... black and red. The corridors are painted battleship grey both on the walls and floor and very dimly lit. The welcome pack had one piece of paper in it telling us it was a no smoking room. There was no room service. We asked for some towels and had to ask twice before they turned up. When checking out we were given a bill for another room that they'd transferred to ours (even though they were for different names and a different room number) and we had to argue that we had only stayed in one room throughout our stay and not been in the other room. We arrived on Saturday afternoon and phoned reception to ask for an iron as most of our clothes were creased from travelling. We were told that they were not allowed to have irons in the rooms (probably 'cause they wouldn't fit in!) but they had an external ironing service. When we asked for this they said we were too late in the evening and they are closed on Sundays so Monday afternoon would be the earliest we would get them back! After about 20 minutes of protesting at the reception desk we finally got someone to iron 4 items for that evening. We had dinner at their rooftop bar and had to use our mobiles for light to see the menu. They only had one toilet up here, which was frosted glass so you could see a shadow through it when you turned the light on and it had no lock on the door. I walked in on some poor woman on the loo, which was embarrassing for both of us. The good thing is it is quite central (about 15 mins walk) to most of the sights in Rome. Rome itself is spectacular so don't let this put you off. One tip.... bring flat shoes as all the roads are cobbled and not good for heals. The Piazza Novana is a great place for dinner, entertainment and to watch the world go by. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate-but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: HorseBox305
Reviews.Content: We visited Hotel la Griffe in August for 3 nights. We expected to arrive in a 5 star hotel, as the website claims. It was soon clear that this was not the case! First impressions of the hotel were not good. The reception staff were unfriendly, abrupt and rude. The website boasts about luxury - 1 pillow = luxury? The room was a Double Superior. It had twin beds and in order to get a double bed the only solution was to zip a double sheet over both mattresses, connecting both beds - the beds were on wheels so they slid apart! Decoration in the room was minimalistic - this may be a personal qualm but in comparison to other 5* facilities it seemed lazy and it just didn't have the finish you would expect. More misleads by the website included the absence of bathrobes and slippers and the wifi was only available at certain times or else you were charged for it and it was only available through the television/keyboard function. We could continue about many more small niggly things but we'd be here all day. The best thing about Hotel la Griffe was it's location. The metro station and the train/bus terminal were within 5 minutes walk from the hotel and major attractions were pretty much all within walking distance. The street seemed to be a good shopping street and there were bars and restaurants all very close to the hotel. The breakfast which was included in our price, was very nice. The view from the rooftop terrace was great and the enthusiasm and friendliness of the breakfast staff almost made up for everything else. If your expectations aren't too high, like ours were, Hotel la Griffe would be a fine hotel to base your stay in wonderful Rome!

Reviews.Title: “very strange hotel, definitely not 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: superMaryland
Reviews.Content: In very expensive 5 stars hotel in the room for three was only 1 chair (to sit on the bed?), no one night stands (where to place eyeglasses, book, glass of water, watch?), no plain napkins (only toilet paper in bathroom), no trash can in the room under the desk, no counterpanes on he beds, no plain sheet (only blanket which is not acceptable in hot august night), no bathing robe, no normal glasses for water (only plastic, after request). All of this we had in 4 stars hotels in Florence and Venice, plus rug on the floor instead of plastic. Terrible! Front desk force you to use privite car instead of regular taxi which is much cheaper. Breakfasts and location are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty 5* with rooms that need major cleaning/refreshing - Great Breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: alwaysthebestforless
Reviews.Content: This place is no way near a 5* quality. More a 3*. The rooms were disgusting, not to mention the mould/grime ridden shower curtain. The reception staff were friendly as well as the breakfast staff. You should not pay more than 50 EUR per night for this room. The hotel reflects the general state of Rome (dirty streets) and the attitude its citizens have towards foreigners.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: TorunnB
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed 4 nights at Hotel La Griffe from Aug 26. 2009. We chose this hotel because a friend recommended it to us. And we are very happy we did. Very elegant entrance and public area; very friendly and helpful staff; the room was impeckably clean and tidy. Very stylish bathroom. Good breakfast every morning at the roof terrace (9th floor) with its magnificent view at Rome's roof tops. We had dinner at the hotel one evening - that was also at the roof terrace. Very good food and a saxophone player played smooth live music. Good food and drinks and the velvet evening air. We appreciated also very much the internet connection and the aircondition. We also used the opportunity to order transfer by private car to and from the hotel, from the airport. The hotel is situated at relatively short walking distance from the main tourist sites. We really loved the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Be Fooled by the La Griffe's Star Rating (5 Star?)”
Reviews.Author: MRR99
Reviews.Content: I was extremely embarrassed because I was responsible for having selected the La Griffe over some other very nice 4 star hotel choices for an extended family vacation in Italy. I did this merely on the basis of its 5 star rating, reasonable price, and good location without examining any of the other Trip Advisor reviews. All of us were disappointed upon arrival. There was not even so much as a sign on the outside of the builiding, which caused our driver to have to pass the hotel twice before he spotted a doorman at the entrance to a building on Via Nazionale that appeared to be a hotel. A standard room in this hotel was barely large enough to accommodate two adults. Also, the rooms are not at all suitable for families since the bathroom walls are constructed of frosted glass, which turned out to be very "see through" as well. There were no windows in either of our rooms, which made it dangerous when the power went out (three to four times during a two-day stay). The air conditioning didn't ever cool properly and was never fixed after having complained about it at the front desk. Unfortunately, it was hard to get any sleep due to the AC problem, which put a damper on our Rome experience altogether. All in all, I would say that this is a 3 star hotel at the very most. I'm not sure how the hotel got away with rating itself as a 5 star, but I assure you that any hotel critic would have a field day with the La Griffe. A big thumbs down for the La Griffe--don't be fooled like I was!

Reviews.Title: “better than we expected from som other reviews”
Reviews.Author: Formulary
Reviews.Content: We had read some other reviews and wondered what to expect. Just as the weather forecast predicted rain and thunder, and we had only sun shine, the doom merchants for this hotel proved equally wrong. Staff were friendly and very helpful, the door man and concierge especially. Our room had a lovely view over the next door church tower and was bright, clean and, yes, just a little too warm. The roof top terrace was an excellent venue for the breakfast which sadly did not quite manage to match the view of St Peter's and the Presidential Palace in the distance. The serving staff though were cheerful and unfailingly helpful. The location enabled us to walk to the Colloseum on one side, and the trevi fountain and Spanish steps on the other without any difficulty. The Vatican is only an hour away at a gentle stroll, which if broken by a lunch stop for a 1.30 tour [ we would recommend Presto Tours ] is an easy day.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Japan_Gaijin
Reviews.Content: This is a good option with good rates. Rooms are nice enough and the location is very central with easy train access. The style is modern but a little tired. Service is friendly but slow. Rooms are adequate but aren't perfectly maintained. Breakfast is okay. The roof top deck has a great view and is a nice place to unwind at the end of the day. We also found the doorman to be exceptional. Stay here because it is reasonably nice and very affordable. Don't expect it to be luxurious or trendy.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: global5000pilot
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews, we knew to ask for rooms with windows to the outside. The rooms got a little warm at night, and got noisy if you opened the windows to cool it down. I had a nice, modern room- basic and simple, but ok. Hard wood floors, 2 double beds and a work station. My bathroom only had a tub with a handheld shower head, but others had a shower with foot massagers. Front desk staff was ok, doorman was very friendly and helpful. Rooftop patio was very cool. Great location, not too far from most sights. I would stay here again. For the price, a pretty good choice, but ask about the A/C and get a window when checking in.

Reviews.Title: “La Griffe - 5 star luxury without a window??”
Reviews.Author: objohnse
Reviews.Content: Just back from our romantic vacation in Rome, I´m sitting here thinking about how our vacation was almost ruined totally by the ” La Griffe”Hotel. Unfortunately we didnt check the hotell reviews on this site prior to packing our bags, but rather trustet the Hotels Five star rating and the word ” Luxury hotell in the discription. Luxury hotel couldn´t be further from the truth…. At first the receptionist, greeted us with great hospitality, the only problem was that he couldn´t find a room key for us. Then we found out that one of the elevators was broken. Also it was a big surprise to us that what they gave us for a romatic crib was a room without a window?? A five star hotell without a window, but rather a glass door to the escape route inside the hotell? My wife and me are really not that picky about accomodation but he story was nowhere near the end. To make a long story short. This is what we found out about the La Griffe Hotel. The elevator didn´t work, and hadn´t been for weeks. The hotel has no atmosphere at all, but is a Art Deco wannabe Hotel with cheap tacky solutions. The corridors are black and dark, be sure to bring a flashlight. No place for kids or senior citizens. We never got our own key. But had to ask for help every time we wanted to get into our room. No explanations as to why. The Bathrooms was terribly small and we never found out how to use the showers. When you complain, (and be sure you will..) the receptionists will probably turn sour on you and be less interested in solutions to your problem, but rather find out what errors YOU made during booking. The breakfast was OK, but was served in the basement. No place to go if you suffer from Claustrophobia. Nor was the room if I might add. The only solution the”La Griffe” presented to us was to upgrade to a bigger room for an extra 300€ a night. Yeah right…. The solution for us was to say thanks for nothing and check out. We ended up in a wonderful bed and breakfast just 3 blocks away. Beautiful view, the room had everything we wanted, taken right out of an old black and white movie….. for 150€ a night. I will be more than happy to tell future visitors to Rome about that place.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kazza08
Reviews.Content: La Griffe is described as a luxury hotel- that must be the biggest joke I've ever heard! The hotel was like a dark, dirty and worn-out cave. The bathrooom was horrible, the tap only had one setting; super jetstrenght, so you'd have to take your clothes off if you wanted to wash your hands without getting soaked! The shower was full of mould and had a useless shower curtain which left the room soaked. Electric fittings were hanging loose and our sheets were not the cleanest I've seen. The only good point about this place is the location. It is quite close to the Colosseum and the rest of the historic centre. Apart from that, my advise is; don't go there!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel. Extremely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: AnonChester
Reviews.Content: Fantastic modern hotel in a fantastic location. Extremely polite staff - especially in the bar upstairs. Very clean and quiet - especially considering central location. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have felt more welcome”
Reviews.Author: Welshie_on_tour
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend when we went to the Italy vs Wales six nations rugby game. All the staff without exception were friendly and helpful. We had a lovely room with a balcony at the back of the hotel. The only down point was that there was often a queue for the lift and a queue for breakfast on one of the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “when booking, make sure you ask for a window!”
Reviews.Author: swnyrawel
Reviews.Content: I didn't choose this hotel, our original 3 star was over booked, so we were sent here, it was a rugby weekend thats why everywhere was full. This is a a modern Hotel, but very dark, it has no atmosphere at all, and no where to go to sit with friends except for the 9th floor roof terrace (2 beers and 2 vodkas £48 euros) so don't bother. Our room didn't have a window so you could not tell if it was day or night, the room was so hot the air con was set at 20.5Degrees and no fresh air, The room was huge set out on 2 floors, very large bathroom and huge bed, but no window. I would never stay there again, every where was dark.

Reviews.Title: “A lots of promises”
Reviews.Author: Anselmius
Reviews.Content: We had two level junior suite, that means very small first floor and small second floor (only beds and walk-in-closet). Bathroom was very large with smoke class wall (not so privacy). Mirror was broken and only 3 hanger in closet. Air conditioning was setup +22,5° by maid and the most lovest temperature to choose was 20° so room was too hot. TV wasn´t plasma. Satellite yeah, BBC and CNN and some locals. Movies from pay TV. ADSL internet in room, 10 €/day and very slow, wireles only at lobby. No bathrobes in 5 star hotel? We update our regular room and they promised an breakfast in room included but they took 10 € for it anyway, we send our emails to proof that promise, but nobody answered. We didn't used restaurant, breakfast buffet was quite poor. Minibar was very expensive. Location is quite good, room were clean. Staff weren't so polite, except doormen.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Design Hotel. Nice roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: Mirkotravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 2-day business meeting. The Hotel is ok, but the meeting room wasnt that great. The food in the restaurant was very average, but at least they had a nice roof terrace to get some fresh air and look across the city. Comparing it to other places in the area this is above the (low) standard of other Roman Hotels of similar price/value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location,”
Reviews.Author: D'Arrigo
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very well located, good service and fair price for Italy. Design hotel, maybe renovated not long ago, an old and beautiful building. On the third floor, room very spacious, in two levels. First level, a living room and a bathroom. Second level the beds and another bathroom. Breakfast at the terrace, an inspiration for the day to start with the top view of Rome. Friendly staff at the front desk and a helpful doorman. Did read the reviews of other trip advisors travelers and got very concern. In my opinion the hotel was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “far too expensive and too noisy”
Reviews.Author: triper_80
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights in La Griffe Hotel on July 2007 with my girlfriend. The size of the room was fine but the bathroom was badly conceived. Apart from that I have only bad comments. he girl at the reception was arrogant. Employees were noisy and we were several time awoken by 7a.m !! Wall coverings and sockets were poorly fitted ! One day we visited the city all day and went back to the hotel only after having dinner. Surpringly the room was not made up. We went to the reception to complain where we were told that "rooms can't be cleaned if we stay in it all day long". I told that I was not on holidays in Rome to stay in my room and asked her to lower the voice and complained to the manager who barely listened to us. Last week I was in Rome and stayed at Casa Montani, plaza del Popolo. It was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: BeeeeSs
Reviews.Content: Beside it's goodlocation, the hotel has nothing else to offer. Our room was on the 8th floor - and none of the elevators was working. we used the stairs (8 floors) to go up and down !!!!!!! No one from the staff bothered to say sorry !!! The hotel inside is very dark and cheap - Black walls, ceilings, etc.... The use the cheapest IKEA products ( cultery, pillows, etc...) Our Room, had a nice view, but a terrible smell of fried food. We complained about it, and all what we got a few sprays out of a botlle of a terrible lemon scented air freshner !!! every night we had to smell it, our room was not far from their restaurant. Noise: You can litteraly every single noise in the corridor ! we heard all the chats, goodmornings and goodnights. We couldn't sleep before 1 am due to the noise, we also had to wake up before 7 am, also due to the noise ! Vibrations: Our room was located directly below the restaurant (for breakfast and dinner) - we heard all the tables, chairs, and high-heels, moving on top of us. Constant vibrations !!!! Breakfast: Forks and knives had a very bad smell !! - breakfast is very basic. With all our complaints, we didn't receive any excuse from the hotel. We tried hard to change our room (Superior Room for 190 Euros a night ) but with no vain. They offered to change the room for an additional 120 Euros a night !!!!!!! Really, the area is full of way better hotels. Don't book in this hotel, we have plenty of choice somewhere else !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Four Star - why”
Reviews.Author: theimportantraveler
Reviews.Content: The staff warmly greets you at their entrance. The terrace is delightful for breakfast and dinner. Rooms are different and unless you know the layout of your room (check it out before accepting it) you can be disappointed. Room 223 and above ( I assume) are quite spacious & one level, Room 224 is very small. Many of the rooms are very tiny and have terrible bathroom features such as the shower (some are miniscule) which floods the floors. Not all rooms come with a bathtub either. Some rooms are 2 levels with an unsafe glass spiral staircase which leads right to the bed. Also a pain for getting your luggage up to the sleeping area. Not too much room to manuver around the bed because the space from the bed to the staircase is bare minimum. Need additional pillows because their pillows are quite thin but the blankets are super and and mattresses are pretty good. Staff responds slow to room difficulties. Cannot change money at the desk. Since breakfast starts at 7:00 am, a coffee machine would be a nice addition, I would not stay here again and I would do my homework much better in checking out hotel rooms. Would not recommend this place for an older American couple. Expected more from a 4 star place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, once we were allowed in...”
Reviews.Author: shermanLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Our flight arrived late and we weren't able to check in until midnight. After a very long flight we were very happy to arrive to La Griffe. It is a very modern, hip hotel in a great location. Unfortunately, we were told our room had "water damage" and we were sent to Hotel Nizza for the night. I had read about this practice on Trip Advisor and let him know that I was aware that there was no damage and that they had overbooked our room. He assured me that they would make it up to us when we returned for our remaining 2 nights at La Griffe. We went to Hotel Nizza and it was AWFUL. Uncomforable, dirty walls, huge disappointment. When we finally checked in to La Griffe they had bumped us up to a 2 level suite that was lovely. At the end of the day it was worth that terrible night. I was very happy and the staff was great. I was pleased that they kept their word and made the situation right.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price but I wouldn't recommend it”
Reviews.Author: W0rldTravelerNY
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the La Griffe, and my main takeaway from the hotel was that it was ok for the reasonable price that we paid (EUR 155/night) but I wouldn't stay there again. Here are the pluses and minuses from our stay: Pluses: -Great location, although still a 15 min walk from the Spanish steps, but it is easy access to the subway, only a couple of blocks, as well as about a 15 - 20 min walk to the colossium and less than that to the forum. Very accessible. - I like the modern style of the hotel - Nice LCD TV in the rooms as well as a bed that was pretty comfortable Minuses: -When we checked in, one of the three rooms we had reserved had a glass door (not a window) that faced into a stairwell. Since the air conditioning was not working yet, it was extremely hot in the room without being able to open a window for air. When we asked to change it, we got a lot of pushback from the front desk and said that we asked for a standard room (our other two rooms did not have this issue and were also standard). I would advise if you stay, ask for a room with a real window. -Pretty bad customer service, when we asked for a concierge for a restaurant suggestion that had entrees under EUR 20 (which we thought was reasonable and in no way cheap), the concierge said that only leaves us with pizzerias and that we should talk to the doorman!!! -Everything is cheap Ikea in the room and the room (standard size) was VERY small. Additionally, the shower wasn't air tight and everything got soaked every time someone took a shower.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: linds0151
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a central place, though you may walk past it as it is on a road with shops. On walking into this hotel it was truly beautful. A noce door man opened the door and the reception area was sparking. The glass counter on the reception looked lovely. The room was very small, a bit cramped if I'm honest/ However it was very moderan with a lovely bathroom! It was in a fab and cetral location, within walking distance to anywhwhere! I would recommend this hotel though be warned the rooms are small small!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: BoomerTravel
Reviews.Content: We ended up at the La griffe after being bumped from the Hotel Milton. Arriving at the MIlton in the early evening after a long flight from Miami they informed us that there computer went down and that our reservation, that I had placed months before, had been lost and that all rooms were occupied. The milton was put us in a cab and moved us to the La Griffe. They assured us that it was a very good hotel along Via nazionale. I knew that to be a good location. Within a ten minute cab ride paid for by the Milton we were greeted by the door man at the La Griffe. A nice touch for Rome. Entered the hotel and promply given a room on an upper floor facing the street. I was a modern two story loft room. The room had the feeling of being brand new. There was a bathrom upstairs near the bed and downstairs in the sitting area. Flat screen TV's located in both locations. A glass spiral staircase led to the upper area. King size bed with very good linen. The room was very very clean. The only shower is in the down stairs bath. You did have to step up and into a new old style tub and pull the curtain around the tub to take a shower. The font desk staff were very helpful and even suggested a resturant that was just great, Tritone. Breakfast was better than average. I get the feeling that they are trying real hard to make this hotel a success. Location was by far the best of all. It was an easy walk to the trevi, steps and the vatican. The train station and metro are also so close it will saves you taxi fare. Via Nazionale is a busy street with alot of stores, resturants, bars and of course people which adds to the excitment of being in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Worse service ever!”
Reviews.Author: sheetalia
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is its location. The customer service is terrible, reception cannot be anymore unhelpful! They were unable to tell us how to get to the airport by metro/bus, the only option they offered us was a 50 EURO taxi ride! (it normally costs 30 EUROS). We had a mini-bar bill for items we hadnt purchased! We ordered a film in our room from pay per view (11.50 Euros) and it stopped half way through (but yet they still charged us) The rooms are the size of cupboards! There is no floor space, just enough for the bed! There is a jacuzzi shower in each room (but no-one will tell you how to use it?) They say they have a fitness room? But only guests staying in suites are allowed to use it. The bar in the hotel is tiny, and each cocktail is about 10 Euros. Overall the customer serice is appalling, I would not recommend anyone to stay in an over-priced hotel which does not offer 4* service but charges 5* prices!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: globalskier100
Reviews.Content: La Griffe is a modern, 'design'-type hotel in a great location. Many of Rome's major sights are within walking distance, and the metro to the Vatican is a stone's throw away. The rooms are clean and comfortable, bathrooms are stylish with multi-functioned power showers. Some of the rooms don't have an external window, but have a window/door opening onto an internal fire escape shaft. This didn't pose a problem for us because it meant the room was very, very quiet. You can hear noise from the busy street in the front-facing rooms. Beware of being "upgraded" to room 315. At the time we stayed, this room had an ongoing problem with its heating, meaning the heating was jammed at 28 degrees C. The air was stifling and not enough cool air came in from the fire escape shaft to cool the room down. The staff, who knew about the problem, didn't tell us about it so we spent quite a bit of time trying to turn the heating down, which was futile. We headed out for the evening and asked the reception staff to fix the problem. They did not, and we were finally moved to another room at 1am after spending an hour waiting for a night staff member to try to fix the heating. We were informed the next day that the heating in the room is not able to be repaired. Two weeks later, the same thing happened to friends of ours who were also "upgraded" to the room. Overall the hotel is great, but the hassles with room 315 did put an unnecessary dampener on our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Never Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: SORRY032
Reviews.Content: The desk staff ruined our Italy trip Nov. 21-27, 2007. 1) They did NOT give us 13 mesages from our family, and the one message they gave us an hour after it came in, too late to do anything. We missed Thanksgiving dinner with our family in Rome and a reception at the U.S. ambassador's residence. When we checked in, we told them we were expecting an important message. They said they would take messages, but there had been none; we told them we would and we did sit in the lobby for 1 1/2 hours and were told none had come in. When we got to our room, we discovered the phone was broken, told the front desk and nothing was done for the rest of our stay. 2) We asked for a wake-up call for the next morning and were told they would give us one. We were not woken up(phone still broken) and missed an event at the Vatican to which we had VIP tickets. 3) We bought our own alarm clock, but asked relatives to also call us. NONE of the 5 phone calls from our relatives was put through to our room(Phone still broken), and, although they said they would, no staff came to our room to wake us. Unless you want to deal with people who lie to you and then provide no services, don't stay at this hotel. You'd be better off staying where the staff at least tells you "no messages".

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Gmar76
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awful - I would not recommend to anyone!! When I book a hotel I make certain assumptions - for example that the room has windows and air flow! How foolish of me. When we turned up we got given a very small room facing into the internal fire escape. I could accept the small sized room, but I was very unimpressed with the lack of natural light and no way of getting air into the room. We asked reception if we could move to a room with windows and they wanted to charge us an extra 100 euros per night (and that was their 'special discount' for us). The room was permanently hot and the air conditioning (if you can call it that) did absolutely nothing. To make our stay even more memorable, the maids took a bottle of wine from our room that we’d bought as a gift to bring home. Unless you're prepared to pay large amounts of money to get a room on the front of the building with a windows, and you're prepared to stay in all day to stop maids from stealing, then I wouldn't bother with this place.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: btravelNewJersey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as part of a large tour group. The rooms were mid sized and reasonably comfortable. While I am all for energy conservation, I found the fact that the bathroom sink had a motion sensor to control the flow of water very annoying. It made simple tasks like washing your face or brushing teeth more difficult than it needed to be. The hotel restaurant had a decent breakfast buffet, typical European continental breakfast fare. The hotel restaurant was disappointing for dinner the one night I chose to dine in because of the rainy weather. The food wasn't particularly memorable. The location was close to the train station and if you were in the mood for a good walk, you can get to most attractions easily.

Reviews.Title: “Too much Grief at La Griffe”
Reviews.Author: BlitzensBelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Griffe from October 12 to October 15 and while the hotel was clean and modern, we expected more out of a four star for the money paid. Upon arrival, we were shown to a room that had no windows to the outside world, the only window in the room was to an elevator shaft and fire escape. When we requested to be shown an exterior room, we were show a slightly larger interior room with two beds and still no window to the exterior. As the hotel wanted an additional 60 Euro per night, we stayed in our original room. There was little soundproofing between the hallway and the room, and as such there was a lot of noise from the hallway and the elevator throughout the night. The next morning we discovered the hairdryer did not work and that the ‘breakfast’ included with our room consisted of a croissant and a cup of coffee, if we wanted the buffet breakfast, it would be an additional 20 Euro. The second day of our stay, our room was not restocked with towels and the hairdryer still did not work. Upon check-out we were presented with an incorrect bill which was 57 percent larger than expected, this was quickly corrected but was annoying. The hotel is located in an area close to the Termini rail station and the metro, as such access to transportation is convenient. However, the area between the Vatican and the Piazza Navona is likely a better place to stay with more restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Top end of town”
Reviews.Author: Victoria71
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel situated out of the old area of Rome but still central to everything. We had a nice room, although as is typical of Italian rooms, quite small. The bar and restaurant on the roof of the hotel offered spectacular night time views of Rome and was popular with guests. The one major drawback is the dreadful breakfast on offer. Well presented but totally lacking in anything of substance and the coffee was diabolical. Reception staff were reasonable but we were amazed to find they would not accept traveller's cheques (in Euros) as payment for any expenses. We found this rather hard to fathom as we didn't have this problem anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “No Griffe at all!”
Reviews.Author: skoobydoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from 18th - 21st August 2007. Very clean and tidy rooms, friendly staff, always helpfull and polite. Had dinner on the roof top terrace restaurant-excellent food. Very modern rooms which would have been made even better with the addition of a kettle to make a coffee, this was the only niggle. Would return with no hesitation at all. Great location for seeing the sites of this wonderful city, all within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Owais
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Rome. We were total 12 Pax in hotel La Griffe. We enjoyed our stay. Staff was friendly , Rooms are Clean. Hotel in new and very good. its 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: M&CUtrecht
Reviews.Content: La Griffe is located at the Via Nazionale, just meters from the Piazza Republica and the Metro station there. Also the most important buses (40 to the Vatican, 64 to the old city and H to Trastevere) stop across the street. The Roman Fora are at the end of Via Nazionale, so you can walk there. If you like walking, the Spanish stairs and the Trevi Fountain are in walking distance (30 minutes walking). So the location is OK, but don't expect the famous small streets of Rome with nice restaurants and wine bars in the neighbourhood. The Via Nazionale is very busy, at night as well. At the street side you won't sleep very quietly... The hotel itself is OK. Trendy, modern designed rooms (we stayed in a superior room, that might make a difference with other rooms). Beds are very hard. Nice big bathrooms. Breakfast is very expensive, but who wants a hotel breakfast when in Rome? Do like the Romans do and get a cappucino and a cornetto (sweet croissant) at the cafeteria down the street. For just a few euros. Breakfast at the hotel is 25! The bar and the restaurant are expensive as well. You'ld better find a nice wine bar and restaurant in old Rome or in Trastevere. We found the hotel nice and modern, but we would prefer a different location next time.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and trendy”
Reviews.Author: LondonKirsty
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with three friends, and while the rooms are a little on the small side, they are extremely comfortable and very modern fixtures and fittings. The downsides we saw were that the advertised roof top bar/restaurant was not open, the jacuzzi on the roof top was similarly closed and full of algae (!) and the reception staff we met were pretty rude. We didn't really let this bother us though as the rooms were clean and comfy and the location suited us.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but needed better housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: AprilRome
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and payed 640 euros w/o Breakfast. I emailed twice to the hotel before our stay and tried to make sure that our reservation was ok , but i never got response. So I called there and ensured that it was ok, like it was after calling there. We asked about breakfast, but they charged 20 eur/person so we chose not to take it. As told before, hotel is very nice and it's location is perfect, but the room was very small (2nd floor) and the safetybox didn't work very well or actually it worked, but had some trubled to open. Another problem that we faced was housekeeping. The room was cleaned everyday, but they never change the towels during our stay, and for being a 4 star hotel we would've expect that. Also they didn't change our glasses or the placticglasse in the bathroom, so still, for a 4 star hotel we would've thought to get it. But otherwise, the staff was friendly and especially the doorman was very helpful. Next time we would choose another hotel,though.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: BenShaw
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 4 days in Rome, and can honestly say, that the staff at La Griffe helped to make it a great trip - they are so pleasant , cheery, and helpful! Nothing is too much trouble, from the breakfast staff who ensure you have everyting you need, to the concierges who are incredibly welcoming! They suggested good places to eat, places to shop, and best travel routes, as well as always having a cheery smile and 'Bonjourno!' on our return to the hotel. Anyone who can be negative about the staff at this hotel, is probably just a negative person anyway! My one comment for it's devlopment would be that it could make better use of the roof terrace which has great views of the city, and would be great to sit and have a coffee on after breakfast, but was empty when we were there. Great location, just a 2 minute walk from the metro, and the bus terminus,and within walking distance of the Trevi Fountain, a great place to explore Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Desperate rooms, no view”
Reviews.Author: irelandeire
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and will never recommend this hotel to anyone. The room we were given had no window(something that seems a small thing but has a huge impact expecially not being able to look out the window and see what the day is like!). The temperature was unberable and after asking on numerous occasions to reduce the heat, it was never done. We were not impressed with this hotel at all and it should be specified when sold as rooms with no windows and expectations might not be high and fewer complaints would be made.

Reviews.Title: “Looked after the sick boyfriend!”
Reviews.Author: g_valentine
Reviews.Content: We did have problems during our stay, but I would rate this hotel as 'excellent' due to the way our problems were dealt with. We did have to change rooms, our original room was on the fourth floor and extremely stylish but unbearably hot with no windows to the outside. The only room available was two grades above ours, but we upgraded for 50 euros a night as opposed to the extra 160 euros a night it should have been. The new room was lovely, huge with a balcony and very bright and airy. My boyfriend became very ill during our holiday, and they helped with a doctor, and let us stay in our room until our late flight as opposed to checking out at 11 as he was too sick to leave. We had a problem with our tv at one point and a maintenance man came immeadiately even though very late at night! The staff helped us with taxis, advice, tours and maps. The breakfast was average european hotel fare, but the food i ordered through room service was very good. The only thing i wouldnt reccommend is their private car service to the airport, the regular taxis cant charge you more than 35 euros under new regulations so dont think their private rate of 50 euros is a good offer! The location is great and we felt very safe. I would definitely recommend the hotel, but would advise not to stay in their most standard rooms based on our experience and the other reivews i've read.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Mickh60
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel to celebrate our wedding anniversary. On arrival we were dealt with politely and efficiently. Our room was super, we had asked for a standard double, and the room was great. The bed was super king size and there was plenty of room for the large plasma tv etc. Very clean, very modern with high ceilings and french doors opening onto the main road. With the doors closed, even at peak traffic, there was very little excess noise, and none during the evening. The hotel did not get upset when we were late checking out as a result of not putting our watches forward. Anything we asked for was sorted quickly e.g a car to the airport. The location was excellent and everything was within walking distance. The Colosseum is essentially at the bottom of the road. The hotel stood up to all our expectations and would not hesitate to stay there again or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “loved the la griffe”
Reviews.Author: KJSouthWales
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for 5 days, we went to see the wales vs italy rugby, after reading coments from others we thought what have we left ourselves in for?, but i must say it was fantastic we stayed in room 314 our friends stayed at 318, both rooms identical, all brand new more like a suit than a room, with spiral glass staircase fantastic bathroom with corner bath shower 2 hand basins w/c and bidet spotlessly clean throughout, double bed two plasma t v,s one in bedroom one in lounge area along with 2 leather arm chairs and desk/dressing table plenty of sockets and lights "large windows" it was fantastic, i must say the breakfast was pretty basic but no less than we expected .the staff all polite, hotel bar comfy and relaxing after a long day on your feet with large leather sofas peacefull and quiet, just a tad expensive , we only drank water from the mini bar in our room and the bill was left each day, and it was refilled, each day we left the money on the receipt and it was taken away, we thought that thats what we were supposed to do untill we went to the main desk on leaving to settle up and was presented with our bar bill, we explained that we had left the money with the bill each day and it had been taken, and as far as we were concerned we had paid it,, but just like our friends in room 318 we were made to pay all over again before leaving,,,,,,,,SO BEWARE ONLY SETTLE YOUR BAR BILL WHAN LEAVING THE HOTEL DO NOT LEAVE IT IN YOUR ROOM,,,,,,,,,,,that was the only gripe we had and the fact that we didnt win the rugby,,, i,m not the easiest person to please, but i must say the la griffe gave me no grief at all, after the comments we read i couldnt believe it when we got there and seen it fantastic***** 10/10 les and kerry joshua south wales

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: elektrobop
Reviews.Content: La Griffe is a fabulous hotel located central to most Rome attractions. (We were able to walk everywhere except the Vatican.) The hotel is very modern and the staff was extremely accomodating. The bathroom was large with a great shower. However, the bedroom was on the small side. (But the bed was extremely comfortable.) We had a beautiful view of the church next door. Like just about anywhere in Rome, you could hear the traffic but that's to be expected. Overall we had a great experience at La Griffe and hope to stay there again on future visits to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before staying at this hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Roxy2310
Reviews.Content: From start to finish this was not a great stay. We got to the hotel and was shown to a 'luxury' room. Hvaing booked a double room with a veiw and called to confirm i was shown to a tiny dark hole with twin beds and no window. We asked to change and they said we couldnt only after insisting they moved us to a room with a double bed and a window that overlooked a heater outside. We could not open the window as the heat was so hot from this thing outside it was unbearable. I paid extra for a delux room and this was NOT that! The maid did not come to change our towls or clean the room so we had to do this ourself. When we checked out they over charged my card. I told them there tand then what they had done and they said they could not refund me as it was a Sunday. This was 38 days ago and i have still had no money back. It is not a small amount of money either. I have called about 7 times and sent about 20 emails, they keep saying they have sent the money to my bank but they have not. The staff have been rude and unhelpful. I have not had a good experiance here and would ask people to think twice before booking. I am very easy going so it takes a lot to anoy me but this hotel has managed to.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: C22
Reviews.Content: Lovely modern hotel in a very convenient location both for the main tourist sites and public transport. We had a standard room on one of the upper floors which was very modern, comfortable and clean with large windows. Staff at reception were very friendly and helpful, they recommended an excellent restaurant near the Trevi Fountain for us and organised the table reservation. The breakfast was slightly limited but no more so than in many other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great place. Will definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: Sixthswan
Reviews.Content: I read a few negative reviews and was a little worried about staying at the hotel. There was no need to worry. Staff at reception were friendly, the rooms are lovely and there is a concierge called Joseph who was fantastic. He gave us a map and suggested the best way to tour the city, recommended restaurants and bars and always had a welcoming smile. Across the road from the hotel there is a bus stop. Catch the number 60 bus for the Colesseum and the 64 for the Vatican. Half way along the 64 route, you can get off to enjoy the other major sites. Stay at La Griffe and enjoy a great location in a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Email the hotel first for a better room”
Reviews.Author: Ratone
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from the La Griffe hotel in Rome and as I am a travel agent I always email the hotels that I stay in to ask for a nice room on a high floor with a nice view, I would reccomend that you do this before you travel the email address for the hotel is [-] the hotel is in an ok location close to the tremini station, but be aware of all the beggers on the street, the room I had was room 311 and it had a nice view of the street and had a large window!!!!! The bathrooms are brand new nice and clean and just the right size, the breakfast is not great but not too bad no windows in the breakfast room but why would they when the room is under ground level!!! Do not be put off by the bad reviews as myself and my boyfriend thought the hotel was fine and staff on the doors very helpful and always open the door for you and give you advise on where to go and eat. I would reccomend that you ask the man on the door for a map of rome so that you can find your way around. The hotel is about a 15min walk to the Trevi Fountain, 25min walk to the collisum, and about 20mins to the Piazza Novana Area you must go here for an evening meal as it is a busy square and lit up by candles. I would rate the hotel 7 and a half out of 10. If you are expecting Dubai standards at the hotel this is not the right hotel for you I would say stay by the Spanish Steps area but overall a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “NO WINDOWS”
Reviews.Author: PIGANDLAMB
Reviews.Content: We had a standard room which should be ok in a 4 star hotel. Unfortunately in this hotel that means no windows, so you do not know if it is day or night. On top of that, the airconditioning was switched off and as the boiler could not be regulated our room was over 30' . We had no window to open to cool the room at night and the heat was unbearable so we could not sleep. They would not offer us another room unless we paid an extra 100 Euros per night. We were to be there 4 nights. Each day, we were promised the problem was solved but after another hot night it obviously was not. I would have thought even a standard room should be comfortable and there was nothing in the room description about the lack of windows. Breakfast did not fare much better, no fruit, same cakes every day, a very poor choice. Again not one window in breakfast room. We had to go to reception every morning before we went out for the day to see what the weather was like so we would know what to wear.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Not a 4 Star Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nyyc
Reviews.Content: 1. Poor Front Desk service. The funniest thing was that we never saw any staff at the custmer relation window during our entire stay. 2. Super small room and bad smell. I doubt they change sheets daily. Amenities such a soap and shampoo were not refilled. 3. Poor quality of breakfast. 4. Okay location.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Experience”
Reviews.Author: GHinton
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews, we ensured that we emailed the hotel before arriving to confirm our booking, and received a positive reply. Perhaps this was worth doing as we received a really nice room with a beatiful view on the 7th floor. However, within 10 minutes of arriving at the hotel we got stuck in the lift and it took another 10 minutes ringing the alarm before someone answered the call and we were "rescued!" Both lifts were then out of order for pretty much the whole weekend, hence lots of exercise climbing those stairs! The day was further marred by our decision to eat dinner in the hotel's terrace restaurant, where we were tortured by a tone deaf 'musician' with a keyboard permanently stuck in 'demo' mode. To top it off, the restaurant staff attempted to overcharge us by 35 euros for items we hadn't ordered, which I then had to argue about in order to have the money refunded. I wouldn't have expected this kind of behaviour from a 4 star hotel. The rooms were in contrast wonderful, with new plasma screen TV's, air conditioning and brand new bathroom fittings. It's a shame that the two incidents above spoilt what would otherwise have been an enjoyable weekend's stay. Given what the hotel charges for a standard room, one would expect better service!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rome, this is NOT a 4* hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cardiffweekenders
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous city for a weekend break. Unfortunately this hotel does not match up to any other 4/5* hotels we have stayed in previously and left us feeling a little disappointed. Plus points: location, cleanliness, friendly and helpful staff, breakfast basic but plentiful. Minus points: at least one, but sometimes both elevators broken for our 4 day stay (not funny when you're on the 8th floor after a days sightseeing!), dark staircases, no views from standard rooms, and no sauna/jacuzzi/massage room. The only jacuzzis we found on the 9th floor were outdoor whirlpool tubs filled with algae (nice). The only way you could use the terrace on the top floor was if you had drinks from their restaurant, unless you just wanted to take a quick peek at the view, which is amazing but only visible from the terrace/9th floor suites. We would rate this as a 3* hotel at best, so try and get a good deal to stop any pain in your wallet!!
